beastmaster.name: Beastmaster
beastmaster.fluff: Countless savage beasts are tamed in Dathen by these renowned handlers. Having earned the approbation of arena crowds for their skill in willbreaking, those who have reached the pinnacle of their art may pursue a career in Caedhren’s temples; others seek military engagements. Their prestige is often so great that they’re immediately granted high-ranking commissions.

black_cloaks.name: Black Cloaks
black_cloaks.fluff: Senior agents of Caedhren’s cult, these specialist operatives are sent to monitor subversives, infiltrate enemy lands or hunt outlaws and warlocks. In a land where freedom is highly valued, the Black Cloaks’ secretive methods fill an important niche, and their honed, discreet application of violence can also make a significant impact in any battle.

corsairs.name: Corsairs
corsairs.fluff: When other mortals think of the Daeb, they most likely picture these seaborne reavers. The brutal, unending raiding of the dread elves is carried out by the corsairs of the Dread Fleet, who take many prisoners, but return none. When facing such a foe, death is often the kinder fate.

divine_altar.name: Divine Altar
divine_altar.fluff: The Daeb bring a bloody-minded fanaticism to their worship of the elven pantheon, especially those serving in battle. Knowing keenly the power of religious and patriotic devotion, Daeb commanders sometimes take battle-altars with them into the fray, demoralising their foes and infusing their most fervent troops with rapturous fury.

warlock_acolytes.name: Dread Acolytes
warlock_acolytes.fluff: Junior initiates of Daeb temples face gruelling regimens demanding physical and mystical prowess. Meanwhile, in the rugged frontier warlock communities, mighty rogue mages demand equal hardiness and determination from new generations of spellcasters they train to ensure the survival and resilience of their outlaw gangs and townships.

dread_knights.name: Dread Knights
dread_knights.fluff: Dread Knights are exclusively composed of nobles and aristocrats – the role is proscribed by law according to exacting criteria, ensuring that only the deadliest riders take up the mantle. Their highly prized raptors make ideal mounts for the Daeb, matching their aggressive and spiteful temperament, and can be kept fed on a diet of dead slaves and enemies.

dread_prince.name: Dread Prince
dread_prince.fluff: Scions of the patrician class, these terrifying and inspiring nobles have an iron will forged on a hundred battlefields, and a mastery of combat techniques born of private tuition. Some deign to contribute their expertise as leaders of Dathen's academies or taming schools. But whether an independent adventurer or a marshal of the Obsidian Thrones, they will prosecute the destiny of the Republic or die in the attempt.

de_elven_horse_mount.name: Elven Horse
de_elven_horse_mount.fluff: From ancient elven stock interbred with the wild herds of Silexia, the mounts of the Daeb are fleet as the wind. Their slight build makes most of them poor bearers of reinforced harness, but in light gear they’re ideal for racing over the prairie, and they can also be trained to endure long shipments across the oceans.

gorgons.name: Gorgons
gorgons.fluff: The Daeb value elven lives highly, so it’s rare for them to offer up their mind and body in the sacrifice needed to create a gorgon. In these eldritch, forbidden rituals devised by the followers of Yema, the supplicant fuses with a supernal of the elven gods, at once blessed and cursed with serpentine forms and a petrifying gaze. Such beings are respected for their power and divinity, despite illicit origins.

harpies.name: Harpies
harpies.fluff: Swarms of humanoid, vulture-like beasts herald the arrival of Daethen’s fleets and armies, feeding on corpses of the slain or ripping apart those they catch off-guard. There are many variant species of harpy, all thought to be the product of ancient experiments. They possess animal intelligence, and are treated much like hunting hounds by their Daeb masters.

hunting_chariot.name: Hunting Chariot
hunting_chariot.shootingweaponsdef:
Harpoon Launcher - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Harpoon Launcher318"363Accurate, Quick to Fire, Harpoon Launcher


Harpoon Launcher
Units that suffer one or more hits from this weapon lose Swiftstride, until the start of the Active Player’s next Turn, and cannot gain it in any way.
hunting_chariot.fluff: Beastmasters deploy harpoons from swift-moving chariots to ensnare, entangle and ultimately capture great beasts for taming and for the arenas. When fighting against enemy monsters, these lighter instruments of abduction can become weapons of war.

hydra.name: Hydra
hydra.fluff: The serpentine hydras of Silexia’s lakes and rivers can grow to great sizes. Their corrosive blood is capable of spectacular regeneration, and when threatened they can even grow decoy heads and necks to better fight back. Moreover, they exhale poisonous clouds, often killing before their multitudinous maws close in on their prey.

de_dragon_mount.name: Imperious Dragon
de_dragon_mount.fluff: Perhaps the only creature that Dathen’s beastmasters have yet to break, dragons are the pinnacle of worldly power, and they only take riders that they themselves have chosen. Those who accept Daeb allies in this way are normally among the most headstrong and prideful of dragon-kind, suffering no enemy to walk free.

judicators.name: Judicators
judicators.fluff: “Peacekeepers” dedicated to the War Crow, judicators are Dathen’s sinister police. Judge, jury and executioner, they enforce the will of the Crow’s Court and monitor communities to prevent unrest. In battle, they extend the gods’ judgement against enemies of the state, zealously using executioner’s weapons to carry out the sentence upon the field.

de_kraken.name: Kraken
de_kraken.fluff: The mightiest of sea beasts, these amphibious tentacled behemoths use tidal shifts and chameleonic hides to hunt in coastal waters around the Shattered Sea and the Great Ocean. They’re prized by Daeb beastmasters and admirals not simply for their magnificence and strength, but their ability to emerge from the waves in a sudden, close-quarters assault upon their foes.

manticore_mount.name: Manticore
manticore_mount.fluff: Combining parts of lion and dragon, the manticore is a mythic nightmare that has long stalked the Silexian interior, as well as nearby islands. A great prize for any taming school, these chimeric beasts are only grudgingly loaned to a military endeavour, for all their ability to decimate enemy troops.

mist_leviathan.name: Mist Leviathan
mist_leviathan.fluff: Few have ever clearly seen a mist leviathan, for the miasma that enshrouds these vast, floating creatures is no mere morning fog, but a thick, steamy vapour emitted by the leviathan itself. Whatever lurks within that shroud, it can hover forwards in eerie silence, leaving no tracks – and frequently, no survivors.

obsidian_guard.name: Obsidian Guard
obsidian_guard.fluff: Veteran soldiers are secretly evaluated and, if deemed worthy, offered a chance to join the legendary Obsidian Guard, mailed fist of the Crimson Consuls. All ties are cut; their old life ends, and a new one of ceaseless training and unflinching dedication begins. The resulting warriors are considered the pinnacle of elven prowess, both by their comrades and their enemies.

blackmane_pegasus_mount.name: Blackmane Pegasus
blackmane_pegasus_mount.fluff: Winged horses cannot normally be bred in captivity, so they must be captured in the wild and broken by expert beastmasters before they will accept a rider. They’re greatly prized in battle; those native to Silexia are famed for dark colouring that gives them a particularly fearsome appearance.

coastal_raptor_mount.name: Raptor
coastal_raptor_mount.fluff: The ultimate predator, perfectly adapted to hunting and bloodshed in any environment, raptors are the only examples of the magna sauria who have spread beyond the continent of Virentia. Dread elves greatly admire their elegant yet lethal reptilian forms, and have succeeded in cultivating their own breeds from eggs stolen around the world.

raptor_chariot.name: Raptor Chariot
raptor_chariot.fluff: Devastating over open ground, Daeb chariots are heavy and brutal when they strike enemy lines. Not all of the splendid metallic ornaments on these machines are decorative; they will shred anything they pass, and whatever survives the impact and the rider will be prey for the bloodthirsty raptors.

repeater_battery.name: Repeater Battery
repeater_battery.shootingweaponsdef:
Daeb Bolt Thrower - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Daeb Bolt Thrower324"852 -

Range 24", Shots 8, Str 5, AP 2. Note that the model can move and shoot.
repeater_battery.fluff: Daeb artillery is adapted to their tactics: rapid manoeuvres over challenging terrain, or nearly silent naval ambushes emerging from fog at close range with a sudden and overwhelming onslaught. As such, they favour mobile ballistas with a high rate of fire, and are prepared to sacrifice range to achieve it.

warlock_outcast.name: Sanctioned Warlock
warlock_outcast.fluff: Twice-forsaken, the warlocks of Silexia are mistrusted masters of the mystic arts, many persecuted by both the Highborn and Dread nations. They have often joined with Daeb exiles to enrich their shadowy power and form outlaw communities beyond Dathen's borders. In rare cases, however, they can be ritually integrated into the Republic's systems of power, earning the right to assist or even lead military ventures with their remarkable arcane talents.

shadow_riders.name: Shadow Riders
shadow_riders.fluff: These mysterious operatives patrol Dathen’s borders and run messages on behalf of Caedhren’s lodges. In battle, their carefully bred steeds run circles around enemy formations, their lithe riders wielding wicked lances and cruel crossbows to take advantage of this mobility.

silent_assassin.name: Silent Assassin
silent_assassin.fluff: Anyone can murder for political gain, but these knives in the dark transcend such self-serving methods of death dealing. Taken by Caedhren’s cult at birth, they’re trained to know only deception and murder, and forget even their own names. Among the world’s deadliest agents, they serve only the gods and the Republic.

silexian_auxiliaries.name: Silexian Auxiliaries
silexian_auxiliaries.fluff: Those who fail to meet the high standards for academy graduation but show an aptitude for marksmanship can still serve the Republic’s armies with a crossbow instead of a spear. A position less glorious but far more survivable, an auxiliary may still reap enough of a reputation on campaign to aid their rise later in life.

silexian_officer.name: Silexian Officer
silexian_officer.leadership:
,
			General=30,
			Battle Standard Bearer=80,
			Captain and Attached=free,
			Solitary=30,
silexian_officer.fluff: The Republic’s hosts are managed by a warrior elite, many rising from the ranks by virtue of personal merit and an eye for strategy. The nobility might rule by custom, but officer graduates command the unshakeable personal loyalty of soldiers who forged bonds with them at the academy and on the battlefield.

silexian_spears.name: Silexian Spears
silexian_spears.fluff: Those who emerge triumphant from the gruelling rigours of the academy, spear-elves are at the heart of Dathen’s military and society. It is from their ranks that the greatest of Daeb warriors emerge, for even fresh graduates exhibit a merciless killer instinct and unflinching discipline.

temple_exarch.name: Temple Exarch
temple_exarch.leadership:
One choice only:,
			General=free,
			Battle Standard Bearer=50,
temple_exarch.fluff: To a people defined by the need for domination and greatness, sacred rites and spells are simply another weapon, and so the leaders of Dathen's temples – warrior-priests trained in weaponcraft and spellcraft alike – are expected to join its armies in battle. These death-dealing chaplains inspire and exhort soldiers even as they bless them.

temple_militants.name: Temple Militants
temple_militants.fluff: The bloody-handed religious fanatics of the Daeb shun armour and embrace slaughter whole-heartedly. They hurl themselves upon their foes in a blinding storm of reckless violence. Using steel consecrated to the Divine Smith, whose full potency can be activated by the priests they follow, they hope to offer bloodshed pleasing to the gods.

thunder_pack.name: Thunder Pack
thunder_pack.fluff: Like the steppes of Augea, the wide prairies of Silexia are home to remarkable megafauna, from giant bison to stranger species. Some live in herds known for earth-shaking stampedes. Corralled by taming school graduates, these beasts provide excellent meat and leather; they can also be trained to develop a bloodscent, and sent into battle on thunderous charges.

beastie_mount.name: Beastie
beastie_mount.fluff: Not needing mounts that can carry such a weight as a fighting orc, goblins are able to ride a much wider range of animals, from familiar wolves, deer, hyenas, cats, and large rodents to stranger species like giant mongoose, lava goats, vulture-geese and dire skunks – or even decidedly unsettling giant insects, arachnids, amphibians and crustaceans. Less physically strong than orcish mounts, all such creatures are formidable in large numbers.

beastie_chariot_mount.name: Beastie Chariot
beastie_chariot_mount.fluff: Though not the largest or most menacing of war vehicles, goblin chariots can be extremely fast and threatening in their own way, and they make for an ideal method of transport for goblin leaders – not to mention facilitating the art of the swift exit.

brood_alpha.name: Brood Alpha
brood_alpha.leadership:
,
			Battle Standard Bearer=70,
			Captain and Attached=free,
brood_alpha.fluff: Orc broods are unable to operate without a single leader to bawl the rest into line. Most alphas are determined in the brood's first brawl and, being the strongest and meanest, are never usurped in the many subsequent brawls of the brood's career - unless there's a closely-matched second. Should they die, a new alpha will be established at the earliest opportunity.

feral_orc_marauders.name: Feral Orc Marauders
feral_orc_marauders.fluff: Some broods encounter beasts which, in their exuberance, they mount (presumably having tried to fight them first) – and thunder all the more joyfully across the land and into battle. These immature raiders display all the control and finesse of a stampede, smashing into enemy ranks with wild abandon. Whether their leader wants them to or not.

feral_orcs.name: Feral Orcs
feral_orcs.fluff: Orc broods that have yet to find (or have only recently found) a larger tribe, whether new-hatched or veterans of many battles, cannot develop the more mature culture and methods of tribal orcs. Instinctively making simple weapons from scavenged materials, they are even more unruly and boisterous than most Warborn, and are wont to indulge in fighting at the scantiest opportunity.

gargantula_mount.name: Gargantula
gargantula_mount.fluff: A subterranean breed of titanic spiders, gargantulas are sometimes tamed by goblins, becoming gogyag: living gods and protectors. Though there are many other kinds of gogyag, these terrifying arachnid giants are preferred by populist goblin leaders, their webs symbolising connection of the many goblin tribes and sects into a single coherent force.

giant.name: Giant
giant.fluff: The Warborn love to adopt dangerous wandering creatures, and giants seek nurturing communities to adopt them. Few pairings are better suited; goblins love them as almost-gogyags, orcs are impressed by their capacity for destruction, and the giants are overjoyed at the loving welcome they receive, wholeheartedly embracing their hosts’ passion for fighting.

gnashers.name: Gnashers
gnashers.fluff: Some of the strangest creatures befriended by goblins are found in caves; those with the biggest teeth and appetites are the greatest favourites. There are many varieties, and some are little more than voracious, fast-moving mouths whose singular purpose in life seems to be that of biting. Though they’re almost impossible to ride, some Gardens have succeeded in herding them into battle.

goblin_artillery.name: Goblin Artillery
goblin_artillery.shootingweaponsdef:
Splatterer - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Splatterer448"173Artillery, Area Attack(2×2), Direct Hit(Multiple Wounds(2))


Git Launcher - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Git Launcher448"1--Artillery, Git Launcher


Skewerer - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Skewerer448"1310Direct Hit(Str 6, Multiple Wounds(D3)), Area Attack(1×5), Skewerer
goblin_artillery.toggles:
onecolprintoptionalmodelrulesdef
		twocolprintoptionalmodelrulesdef
		onecolprintoptions
		twocolprintoptions
		onecolprintshootingweaponsdef
		twocolprintshootingweaponsdef
goblin_artillery.fluff: Killing at distance is a particular pleasure for goblins, and one into which they put a good deal of effort, amusing themselves by devising new and interesting ways to crush or skewer their foes. Their weapons use many unconventional forms of ammunition – including themselves. Some gogtuk are willing to get truly “high” from a launch into enemy lines – and amazingly, not all of them perish on impact.

goblin_chariots.name: Goblin Chariots
goblin_chariots.fluff: Goblins are excellent charioteers; not so skilled, perhaps, but certainly keen to hit hard and get away quickly. Lightweight chariots fashioned from special materials harvested from the Gardens are pulled into battle by beasts that are often loathsome to their enemies but always adored by their Warborn friends, who rely on their speed for survival.

goblin_demagogue.name: Goblin Demagogue
goblin_demagogue.leadership:
,
			General=10,
			Battle Standard Bearer=60,
			Solitary=10,
			Captain and Attached=free,
goblin_demagogue.fluff: Goblins naturally revere their populist leaders; most of all, they delight in those who can tell the most brazen lies without being caught. Demagogues lead one or more of a Garden’s tribes, and often they lead the (not-so) secret sects as well, making them peerless rabble rousers and the only individuals capable of directing the chaos of a goblin society in a single direction.

goblin_rabble.name: Goblin Rabble
goblin_rabble.fluff: Taking courage in numbers, goblins attack as a shoving mass of bodies completely untrained in conventional warfare. With ragged arms and armour often derived from organic material, they are known to use the natural toxins of their Garden for extra potency. If their numbers and their poisons fail them, there’s always running away; goblins can switch from terror to elation and back again in moments, their whims taking them to and from the fray – sometimes as part of a larger scheme.

goblin_reavers.name: Goblin Reavers
goblin_reavers.fluff: Though lacking great power, the many weird and wonderful creatures used by goblins for mounts are prized for their versatility and speed, allowing the riders to harry and steal while staying out of harm’s way. Commonly used for sudden pillaging raids, such reavers can also add a tactical edge when the Gardens go to war.

goblin_witch.name: Goblin Witch
goblin_witch.fluff: Those within a sect who show magical skill learn to develop their talents in the service of Goga and the great project of cheating death. Embracing a disorderly yet highly potent style of magecraft, they are called witches regardless of the Path they follow, seeking to align themselves with the form of magic that most encourages deception.

gogtuk_initiate.name: Gogtuk Initiate
gogtuk_initiate.fluff: Those who are chosen for – and survive – initiation into the exclusive sects of Goga are among the most cunning of all goblins, and the most willing to take great risks while seeking great rewards. Many such gogtuk have mastered an array of wild tricks, traps, self-medication, and special stabbing skills – making them very dangerous to their enemies…as well as to themselves.

gogtuk_neophytes.name: Gogtuk Neophytes
gogtuk_neophytes.fluff: Even the newest initiates of a goblin sect are deeply cunning and well-versed in the mysteries of plant-lore and Goga. Gifted in the arts of poison and stealth, though not yet ready to attempt great acts of daredevilry, they can appear where least desired and run amok with their wicked weapons. With the right timing, such manoeuvres can alter a battle just as surely as the fortunes of nations.

great_green_idol.name: Great Green Idol
great_green_idol.fluff: Using emerald keystones powered by the souls of those slain in battle, large rock statues can be activated by the sound of war drums. The ultimate expression of Warborn unity, these constructs are created by orc and goblin mages harnessing the twin powers of Wapaka and Goga. Unstoppable in battle, the idol will finally de-animate when there are no more enemies left to fight.

grotlings.name: Grotlings
grotlings.fluff: Grotlings lack strength or cunning, but retain the Warborn’s enthusiasm for the fight. Emerging from the pits stunted and weak, they cannot join their birth broods, instead forming adoptive broods with each other, often treasured and protected by the larger Warborn. Eager to please, they can assault enemies with a tremendous range of weapons they have found, made or stolen. Moving in gleeful swarms, they’re heedless of danger once the battle-joy takes hold.

grotling_scrap_wagon.name: Grotling Scrap Wagon
grotling_scrap_wagon.fluff: Particularly unbalanced grotlings may, in an attempt to curry favour, build eccentric contraptions in which to hurtle into battle. Many resemble little more than junk with the odd wheel, but some prove not only operational but highly effective. The lifespan of the wagoneers is typically short, but this does not appear to concern them – indeed, it’s more often a subject for their bet-making.

grunter_mount.name: Grunter
grunter_mount.fluff: Sturdy and aggressive creatures of orcish stature can be found in every part of the world, though they appear in many shapes and sizes. Hogs of all kinds are popular, though some are only loosely related to porcine creatures. They all share an instinct for wrathful headlong charges that makes them a favourite among orcs.

grunter_chariot_mount.name: Grunter Chariot
grunter_chariot_mount.fluff: Though the construction of these war wagons is often rudimentary, their effectiveness in battle is always brutal. Orcs would never go to the effort of building something that doesn’t help them to smash.

guardian_behemoth.name: Guardian Behemoth
guardian_behemoth.fluff: Goblins seek out the world’s most frightening, unusual and enormous creatures to become the divine gogyags, which they revere as gods and unleash upon any who discover or attack their secret cities. Goblins feel that such monstrous protectors serve to even the score in terms of size – something enemies surely appreciate as they are crushed, ripped art or just eaten.

iron_orc_chariots.name: Iron Orc Chariots
iron_orc_chariots.fluff: The tribe’s best crafters often learn to build vehicles of violence for themselves or their leaders, perhaps more rugged than those of other cultures, but still strong and ferocious. Chariot races are a great favourite at the inter-tribal Games of Zagjan, as well as on the field. With a crew of hardened warriors, such a chariot can carve its bloody way through almost any enemy formation.

iron_orc_loner.name: Iron Orc Loner
iron_orc_loner.fluff: Orcs can never join new broods. The last survivor of a brood will therefore be alone the rest of their lives. Solitary and grim, such warriors are inevitably unsurpassed in combat, covered in scars and battered steel, bristling with every kind of weapon. It’s said that eventually such figures will tire of the tribe altogether, departing on a final lonely journey to find their last and greatest battle.

iron_orcs.name: Iron Orcs
iron_orcs.fluff: Few orc warriors survive their feral years, and even fewer adulthood, but those that do become true masters of war. Highly skilled combatants, many also become impressive blacksmiths, able to create a multitude of horribly effective weapons and heavy metal armour. Still living to fight, they now know how to survive as well, making them the fearsome iron fist of the Warborn.

mad_git.name: Mad Git
mad_git.fluff: Whether naturally fanatical or addled by too many substances, gogtuk sometimes drive themselves to the ultimate acts of daring, seeking to trick death by those acts most likely to embrace it. Hurling themselves into the most dangerous foe with frightening madcap weaponry, they inevitably extinguish both themselves and anyone standing nearby.

orc_shaman.name: Orc Shaman
orc_shaman.fluff: Certain rare orcs are marked from the moment they hatch; their brood instinctively treats them as separate, and they innately seek a connection with a greater whole – both the whole tribe, and the whole of the cosmos in the form of Wapaka itself. Learning from other shamans how to form a deeper bond with this primal force, they soon become savage masters of magic.

orc_warlord.name: Orc Warlord
orc_warlord.fluff: Fighting and leading is the same thing to an orc. Brood alphas frequently challenge each other to prove their supremacy; the victor leads the tribe to the next battle. To assert dominance over an entire tribe of born fighters is a task achievable only by the greatest in both raw strength and natural skill.

pet_monster_mount.name: Pet Monster
pet_monster_mount.fluff: Some of the larger, gnarlier creatures ridden by goblins can also form the closest bonds, with mount and rider adopting each other as family. Better suited for war than smaller mounts, these fighting creatures give their riders both companionship and protection, and can greatly enhance the deadliness of a goblin warrior.

trolls.name: Trolls
trolls.fluff: Natural scavengers, trolls have developed symbiosis with the Warborn as protectors of their breeding pits, fending off predators in return for whatever’s left after hatching. They’re gnarled and hardy creatures that have evolved to reflect their surroundings; many have an inexplicable affinity for bridges. Peaceful unless roused, they defend their own families to the death, lashing out at any who harm their fellows.

veteran_orc_marauders.name: Veteran Orc Marauders
veteran_orc_marauders.fluff: The Warborn retain their affinity for wild beasts at all ages. Mature orcs learn the ways of marauding to an ever-deeper extent, never losing the joy of crazed charges into the fray. This mobility and the opportunity to command large swathes of the battlefield with fearsome cavalry is a significant boost to Warborn military strategy, such as it is.

veteran_orcs.name: Veteran Orcs
veteran_orcs.fluff: If a feral orc brood lives long enough to reach a larger tribe, it will slowly mature into slightly more sedate adults. A plethora of fights have, by this stage, honed the orcs’ skills in battle, and they may learn to fashion or steal more advanced weaponry. Though the flames of youth have cooled, their orcish love of war and combat is undiminished, and there is little such seasoned fighters do not know about battle.

wrecking_team.name: Wrecking Team
wrecking_team.fluff: Certain very intoxicated (“visionary”) gogtuk have devised perhaps their most absurd scheme yet: taking two or more really big gnashers or equally rabid creatures, chaining them together, pumping them full of the Garden’s most exciting drugs, and releasing them upon the enemy. The result is so violent and destructive that it rarely lasts more than a moment after contact, with no survivors on either side.

wyvern_mount.name: Wyvern
wyvern_mount.fluff: Draconic in appearance, wyverns are smaller than dragons, have only two limbs in addition to their wings, and lack both intelligence and firebreathing. Though no other species has been able to tame them, their very wildness gives these venomous flying serpents a close affinity to the Warborn.

bull_of_shamut_mount.name: Bull of Shamut
bull_of_shamut_mount.fluff: God of violence, Shamut is usually depicted with the head of a bull. His clergy has perfected great public rituals, involving copious bloodshed, that are sometimes successful in gaining the god’s favour, summoning a supernal avatar. Appearing as enormous winged bulls, their hooves and horns wreathed in fire, these beasts permit particularly worthy supplicants as riders.

citadel_guard.name: Citadel Guard
citadel_guard.fluff: A dwarf who has finished their twenty years in the military can call themselves a Guard of the Citadel. Most pursue other careers, but some find violence has become second nature. These doughty, determined mercenaries will fight for any Infernal willing to pay their fee – but once the Guard have taken a contract, their word is their bond.

citizen_giant.name: Citizen Giant
citizen_giant.fluff: Infernal legends hold that their gods made both dwarves and the good-natured behemoths known as giants. Giants are offered the same equipment, duties and rights as any dwarf: the only other species permitted to bear Infernal Brands. The giants love feeling like they belong, the dwarves take pride in their big brothers, and their enemies suffer the results.

disciples_of_lugar.name: Disciples of Lugar
disciples_of_lugar.fluff: The Disciples of Lugar are roguish battle lawyers and tricksters. Finding loopholes in laws both mortal and divine, Lugar and his disciples are believed by some to have tricked their way into becoming the fourth god and temple. Today, some use precise pacts branded on their skin to bind kadim into their very flesh and gain their powers.

great_bull_of_shamut_mount.name: Great Bull of Shamut
great_bull_of_shamut_mount.fluff: Shamut’s pets are sent for the express purpose of casting down the servants of enemy gods in order to glorify the Infernal Vaneb. The greatest are true behemoths, red-hot fire engulfing the foe with each furious snort of their nostrils. The coming of such a creature is regarded as a great miracle of divine favour.

gunnery_team.name: Gunnery Team
gunnery_team.fluff: One of the more recent advancements in Infernal technology has been the creation of small, dwarf-portable mobile artillery. These rocket launchers, flamethrowers and mortars are issued to common soldiers and carried by them into battle. Already, many dwarves report a fondness for the smell of naphtha in the morning.

immortals.name: Immortals
immortals.fluff: Most dwarves will fight to the death for honour, but the masked, armoured Immortals go still further to protect their people and their lieges. Unflinching, emotionless, they are never seen without their helms. Even in death, their souls are said to remain within the masks, whispering ghostly advice until even the strongest mind can no longer tell its own thoughts.

infernal_artillery.name: Infernal Artillery
infernal_artillery.fluff: Enormous, earthshaking, factory-built machines, Infernal artillery pieces are modular and thus versatile – but primarily built to launch the heaviest possible payloads. When these devastating barrages are unleashed upon hapless foes, those not sent to the afterlife often take a long time to realise that they’ve survived.

infernal_bastion.name: Infernal Bastion
infernal_bastion.fluff: Dwarves are renowned for their fortifications; the Infernal dwarves prefer to take theirs with them when they go to war. Iron-clad siege towers equipped with a battering ram and lined with enough firing platforms for a score of soldiers, an Infernal bastion combines the defensibility of a watchtower with the relentless advance beloved of the Infernal dwarves.

infernal_engine.name: Infernal Engine
infernal_engine.fluff: The Steel Road stretches from the Blasted Plain to Tsuandan through the heart of the Sky Mountains. Its massive, belching, kadim-powered engines are encrusted with enough armour and guns to fight their way past any ambush or raid, and can be adjusted to travel off-track when needed on a battlefield.

infernal_warriors.name: Infernal Warriors
infernal_warriors.fluff: In other lands, warrior-aristocracies might form a knightly class. In the Blasted Plain, every dwarf forms the warrior class, and every dwarf learns to fight. The flame-proof armour they receive, together with the brand that symbolises the Inferno, are core components of identity: to be an Infernal dwarf is to have been an Infernal warrior.

kadim_chariot.name: Kadim Chariot
kadim_chariot.fluff: Uncomfortable with raising and training war beasts, Infernal dwarves have never mastered conventional cavalry or chariotry. Important followers of Lugar have recently broken with this tradition and bound Kadim to serve as pulling beasts for sturdy chariots, blazing fiery trails across the fields of war.

kadim_incarnates.name: Kadim Incarnates
kadim_incarnates.fluff: Supernal creatures, kadim generally enter the Mortal Realm through the damage wrought to the Veil at the site of the Inferno. Servants of the Vaneb embodied in raw lava, they are prepared to bargain with Infernal dwarves, accepting mystical contracts that trade their services in exchange for dwarf-forged metal bodies able to contain and channel their fiery power.

kadim_titan.name: Kadim Titan
kadim_titan.fluff: The towering kadim titans are among the mightiest of supernal beings able to enter the Mortal Realm without the world itself cracking. Unlike smaller kadim, each titan is housed in a unique design, the magnum opus of their magus-engineer, equipped to wreak devastation in combat or bearing fearsome Infernal artillery.

lamassu_scholar.name: Lamassu Scholar
lamassu_scholar.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spells from the following:
lamassu_scholar.fluff: Chimeric winged bulls with leonine bodies and human heads, relatives of Napteshi sphinxes and Tsuandanese qilin, the sorcerous scholars known as lamassu are allied to the Infernal dwarves and highly valued for their knowledge and wisdom. On rare occasions, their dwarven apprentices may even succeed in convincing a lamassu to assist in open combat.

overlord.name: Overlord
overlord.fluff: Chosen by the prophets but not necessarily beholden to them, overlords have supreme authority over their Citadel: kings in all but heredity. To ascend to such greatness, an overlord must be powerful, ruthless and wealthy beyond normal measure. When they take to the battlefield, they’re among the best equipped warriors in the world.

prophet.name: Prophet
prophet.fluff: Priests trained in sorcery to maintain the power and authority of the Temples, prophets are said to speak the word of the Vaneb. As such, they command obedience, fear and reverence from the populace of the Blasted Plain. Prophets wear armour and bear arms, as befits the mages of such a sturdy and ferocious people.

seat_of_authority_mount.name: Seat of Authority
seat_of_authority_mount.fluff: Thrones have been important symbols to dwarves of all kinds ever since the days of the ancient empire. Today, while most overlords seek to project a more vigorous attitude in battle, other Infernal grandees still sometimes go to war seated. The governors of vassal provinces are particularly fond of demonstrating their power this way, carried on the backs of their minions.

shackled_slaves.name: Shackled Slaves
shackled_slaves.fluff: Those who refuse to surrender to Infernal rule, or are deemed beneath service, are sentenced to become slaves. Drugs, whips, manacles – compliance is forced by a variety of brutal means. Driving mobs of these wretches forwards for advantage on the battlefield is often deemed profitable by their steel-hearted masters despite the loss of capital.

taurukh_anointed.name: Taurukh Anointed
taurukh_anointed.fluff: The Anointed are proof that Infernal dwarves are relentless in their pursuit of ever-greater power, in magic as well as battle. Products of an augmented taurukh transformation, each would-be Anointed must rear a bull-calf by hand to adulthood before personally sacrificing their beloved pet and fusing with it.

taurukh_commissioner.name: Taurukh Commissioner
taurukh_commissioner.leadership:
One choice only:,
			General=free,
			Battle Standard Bearer=50,
taurukh_commissioner.fluff: Dwarves grafted to the lower body of a bull, taurukhs serve as the Infernal police force, a position won by violence in the Taurukh Revolt. Some of the new Anointed have risen through the ranks to the position of Commissioner; these unflinching leaders are beloved by their officers and feared by their enemies.

taurukh_enforcers.name: Taurukh Enforcers
taurukh_enforcers.fluff: Sorcerous hybrids of dwarven warriors and mighty bulls dreamed up by the crazed prophet Madzhab and forged in blood sorcery, taurukhs are the iron fist of the Code of Kemurab. These officers of the law permit only those they deem worthy to be recruited into their ranks and granted the honour of the Taurukh Ritual.

vassal_cavalry.name: Vassal Cavalry
vassal_cavalry.fluff: Dwarves have no knack for riding, so the Infernals bully conquered peoples into providing them with trained light cavalry. Satraps who send inferior specimens can be conscripted themselves as a punishment, so these troops tend to be skilled but politically unpopular “volunteers”.

vassal_conjurer.name: Vassal Conjurer
vassal_conjurer.fluff: The Infernal dwarves, being relatively few in number, tend to supplement their forces with non-dwarven minions of questionable loyalty. Those who have learned sorcery from their own cultures are considered valuable yet expendable assets by their masters.

vassal_levies.name: Vassal Levies
vassal_levies.fluff: Interchangeable in the eyes of their masters, these conscripts are taken from among populations of humans, hobgoblins, beasts and other species living under the Infernal yoke. Still, dwarves seldom take half-measures; levies are usually drilled ferociously and equipped with special vials of sticky oil to make them more useful.

vassal_slingshot.name: Vassal Slingshot
vassal_slingshot.shootingweaponsdef:
Vassal Slingshot - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Vassal Slingshot448"1310Area Attack(1×5), Direct Hit(Str 6, Multiple Wounds(D3)), Oil Flasks(4)
vassal_slingshot.fluff: Simpler, torsion-powered artillery doesn’t explode in a manner pleasing to Nezibkesh, but it can still be useful. The creation and manning of such utilitarian devices is thus left to non-dwarven conscripts.

vassal_steed_mount.name: Vassal Steed
vassal_steed_mount.fluff: The commanders of vassal detachments often bring their own mounts to war – usually horses or camels for human troops, while other species may prefer more unusual beasts from the Blasted Plain, from wolves to hogs, and many more.

vizier.name: Vizier
vizier.leadership:
,
			General=20,
			Battle Standard Bearer=70,
			Captain and Attached=free,
			Solitary=20,
vizier.fluff: Ambitious dwarves seek positions of power, and the roles of vizier or satrap are certainly appealing to such determined individuals. Viziers advise the overlords, while satraps serve as regional governors overseeing conquered vassals.

blazing_glory.name: Blazing Glory
blazing_glory.explicitoptions:
Brimstone Secretions=10,
			Horns of Hubris=15,
			Golden Helm=20,			
			Bronze Backbone=25,
			Trampling Hooves=50,
blazing_glory.fluff: Large, imperious and scornful daemons of Pride, a glory’s power lies in its untouchable prestige and arrogance. Once they’ve been wounded by an opponent, their deadliness begins to wane, yet they remain formidable figures so long as their form endures.

bloat_flies.name: Bloat Flies
bloat_flies.explicitoptions:
Unholy Appetite=8/model,
			Digestive Vomit=8/model,
			Unhinging Jaw=12/model,
			Kaleidoscopic Flesh=6/model,
bloat_flies.fluff: Repulsive, wasp-like daemons of Gluttony, bloat flies are deadly, striking hard and fast with sharpened stingers or mandibles. Their blood is lethally noxious, and some seem to have humanoid riders – though in truth these body parts are offshoots of the same daemon. They can be notoriously difficult to injure, even more so than other daemons.

brazen_beasts.name: Brazen Beasts
brazen_beasts.explicitoptions:
Incendiary Ichor=4/model,
			Curved Tusks=16/model,
			Whipcrack Tail=10/model,
			Horrifying Visage=5/model,
			Chitinous Scales=6/model,
brazen_beasts.fluff: It can be hard for some to tell whether these daemons of Wrath – stampeding engines of war driven by dark energies and hellish contraptions – are beast or machine. They encourage smaller devils of Wrath to accompany them, only enhancing the devastation of their charges.

burning_wheel_mount.name: Burning Wheel
burning_wheel_mount.fluff: Sometimes composed of flesh and other times of metal, these peculiar daemons appear to have little will of their own, being content to convey their superior kin. Shaped like discs and often producing the illusion of kaleidoscopic flames, they have the ability to float effortlessly through the air.

clawed_fiends.name: Clawed Fiends
clawed_fiends.explicitoptions:
Unholy Appetite=7/model,
			Unhinging Jaw=12/model,
			Incendiary Ichor=3/model,
			Piercing Spike=10/model,
			Mesmerising Plumage=6/model,
clawed_fiends.fluff: Large centaur-like creatures with a rudimentary exoskeleton and vicious claws, these terrifyingly fast, insectoid daemons are desperate for attention and love. Particularly attracted to mortals of their own size, they embrace them, not realising their own strength or the sharpness of their claws. When their victims stop moving, they look for new ones.

courtesan_of_cibaresh.name: Courtesan of Cibaresh
courtesan_of_cibaresh.fluff: Sometimes humanoid, sometimes bestial, often androgynous, these merciless denizens of the Lust God’s harem have tall, thin bodies and long limbs – often ending in wickedly sharp weaponry. In battle they become a whirlwind of joyous bloodshed, particularly when they can take their victims unawares.

dark_pulpit_mount.name: Dark Pulpit
dark_pulpit_mount.fluff: Daemons are the ultimate evangelists of the Dark Gods; even as they attempt to tear down the world, they also seek converts to their scandalous faith. From the summit of this abyssal chariot – sometimes drawn on the backs of lesser daemons, other times levitating serenely – they can preach the word of their masters and glorify their names.

eidolons.name: Eidolons
eidolons.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spells from the following:
eidolons.explicitoptions:
Incendiary Ichor=2/model,
			Kaleidoscopic Flesh=6/model,
			All-Seeing Eye=8/model,
			Sorcerous Antennae=35,
eidolons.fluff: These daemons are made of viscous hues that seem to ooze and gurgle without any regard for gravity. Screaming limbs and faces can be seen within the plasma, disgorging magical flames that test the will of their victims. Sometimes these creatures can focus their energy as a group to inflict spells even more lethal than the flames.

furies.name: Furies
furies.explicitoptions:
Venom Sacs=1/model,
			Curved Tusks=1/model,
			Dark Hide=1/model,
			Mesmerising Plumage=3/model,
			Kaleidoscopic Flesh=2/model,
furies.fluff: Madness takes physical shape when these daemons visit the Mortal Realm. Winged beasts of unsurpassed speed and ferocity, they are said to punish wrongdoers, and they never give up their chase.

great_beast_of_prophecy_mount.name: Great Beast of Prophecy
great_beast_of_prophecy_mount.fluff: These dramatic creatures can only be tamed by the strongest-willed daemons. Normally they are chimeric in form, combining parts of the most impressive mortal creatures, but rarely in the same manner as worldly chimeras. These monsters have often plagued the dreams and visions of diviners and prophets, particularly in periods preceding major daemonic incursions.

harbinger_of_father_chaos.name: Harbinger of Father Chaos
harbinger_of_father_chaos.leadership:
,
			General=30,
			Battle Standard Bearer=80,
			Captain and Attached=free,
			Solitary=30,
harbinger_of_father_chaos.fluff: Certain daemons serve the highest principle of entropy: the infinite being some call Father Chaos. Solitary and mysterious, they’re formidable warriors and potent mages, taking an array of forms across the daemonic spectrum and often electing to master lesser daemons as mounts. Most prominently display the Father’s sigil, acting as a guiding beacon for their kin.

hellhounds.name: Hellhounds
hellhounds.explicitoptions:
Hot Blood=1/model,	Incendiary Ichor=1/model,		Dark Hide=2/model,
			Digestive Vomit=2/model,
			Horns of Hubris=1/model,
hellhounds.fluff: Great canine brutes, most often covered in thick black fur, with jagged teeth protruding from elongated snouts and eyes that smoulder with unholy fire, these fiends of Hell put the knowledge of ancient, primordial fear into the hearts of all who hear their awful baying.

hellsteed_mount.name: Hellsteed
hellsteed_mount.fluff: While they may be lesser daemons accustomed to serving those of greater potency, the dire steeds of the Dark Gods are fell creatures in their own right. Taking a range of fearsomely fast-moving forms, such beasts have found a niche as the natural mounts for any daemon wishing to move more rapidly across the Mortal Realm.

hoarders.name: Hoarders
hoarders.explicitoptions:
Clinging Ichor=3/model,
			Smothering Coils=14/model,
			Mirrored Scales=15/model,
			Unnatural Roots=50,
			Chitinous Scales=4/model,
			Segmented Shell=3/model,
hoarders.fluff: These large daemons of Greed slime and writhe their way over the ground. Some resemble grotesque toads, insects, serpents or simply globules of slimy flesh, gathering up detritus and riches alike as they move. They smother or strangle their victims, growing stronger and gripping ever-tighter the longer they struggle.

hope_harvester.name: Hope Harvester
hope_harvester.explicitoptions:
All-Seeing Eye=30,
			Torporous Tendrils=55,
			Sorcerous Antennae=35,
			Hell Can Wait=40,
			Mark of the Eternal Champion=50,
hope_harvester.shootingweaponsdef:
Aether Battery
NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Aeth. Battery318"3D641Magical Attacks, If the model did not move this turn, the number of shots gains Maximised
hope_harvester.fluff: Despite having the power to crush anything that dares approach, hope harvesters prefer to attack their foes with projectiles of pure magic, before feeding on the despair of survivors. Creatures of Sloth, these patient structures often attach themselves to other groups of daemons who can do most of the work for them, or else form immense bodies to house their potency.

imps.name: Imps
imps.explicitoptions:
Incendiary Ichor=1/model,	
			All-Seeing Eye=1/model,	
			Dark Hide=2/model,		
			Mark of the Eternal Champion=30,
			Sorcerous Antennae=50,
imps.fluff: Imps are a particularly broad category of daemon that spans tiny homunculi all the way to man-sized elementals. Most often, they are brightly coloured, goblin-like creatures firing deadly pyroclastic bolts from limbs or orifices, driven by their love of arson.

kuulimas_deceiver.name: Kuulima's Deceiver
kuulimas_deceiver.fluff: The greater daemons of Envy have developed the ability to adapt their own form to mimic their enemies, matching blow for blow. Usually they’re not far from humanoid, albeit with grotesquely exaggerated characteristics, fiendish adornments and often brightly coloured skin.

lemures.name: Lemures
lemures.explicitoptions:
Torporous Tendrils=2/model,
			Unnatural Roots=50,
			Centipede Legs=2/model,
			Golden Helm=1/model,
			Brimstone Secretions=1/model,
lemures.fluff: These daemons typically appear as sickly or deceased mortals. Some take bodies with no definition at all: shapeshifting mutants of fleshy tumours. Their malleable forms are difficult to fatally wound, or even to strike at effectively.

mageblight_gremlins.name: Mageblight Gremlins
mageblight_gremlins.explicitoptions:
Venom Sacs=10/model,
			Piercing Spike=10/model,
			Hell Can Wait=12/model,
			Charged Tendrils=10/model,
		,
mageblight_gremlins.fluff: With their wicked grins full of razor teeth, their gelatinous flesh and their little protruding horns, these small, obese daemons of Envy are quite deadly in a swarm. They despise mortal wizards, intensely jealous of their ability to use the substance of the Immortal in the Mortal Realm, and are an ever-present threat to a spellcaster who thins the Veil too far.

maw_of_akaan.name: Maw of Akaan
maw_of_akaan.fluff: Greater daemons of Gluttony appear as a vast fleshy mass, intent on devouring and absorbing as much as they can, even to their own undoing. Whether bestial or amorphous in appearance, the only common feature is the enormous mouth, typically barbed with endless teeth.

miser_of_sugulag.name: Miser of Sugulag

defensearmour.name: Resistance
params: against attacks from the Front Facing

miser_of_sugulag.fluff: Fat and sickly, their very flesh rotting and falling from their forms, the greater daemons of Greed are often slow and cumbersome. Yet their mucousy bodies are cushioned by obscene armour, composed of the many items, substances and creatures they collect as they move through the Mortal Realm: a grotesque accumulation further augmented by the magic they hoard with equal avarice.

myrmidons.name: Myrmidons
myrmidons.explicitoptions:
Unhinging Jaw=2/model,
			Hot Blood=1/model,
			Whipcrack Tail=4/model,
			Bronze Backbone=3/model,
			Piercing Spike=3/model,
myrmidons.fluff: With their hooves and reptilian tongues, myrmidons are the twisted mirror image of elite mortal warriors, brandishing extensions of their own limbs that mimic iron weaponry. Called by many different masters, they form regimented battalions, adopting uniform colours reflecting their martial inclinations.

omen_of_savar.name: Omen of Savar
omen_of_savar.fluff: The princes of Pride are regal and humanoid, often with intimidating attributes of apex predators, such as great wings, long tails and horns shaped like a crown. Masters of single combat, they command such a sense of superiority that most mortals cannot help but cower in their presence.

sentinel_of_nukuja.name: Sentinel of Nukuja
sentinel_of_nukuja.fluff: Servants of She who sees the beginning and end of all, the greater daemons of Sloth dedicate themselves to true mastery of magic. Watchers, knowers, schemers, they condescend to physical movement as little as possible. Often avian in form, they may occasionally take to the skies to secure a better vantage, or simply sail across the battle on sorcerous platforms.

succubi.name: Succubi
succubi.explicitoptions:
Dark Hide=1/model,
			Horrifying Visage=1/model,
			Mesmerising Plumage=2/model,
			Torporous Tendrils=3/model,
			Bronze Backbone=4/model,
succubi.fluff: Lithe, nimble, humanoid creatures that move with unnatural grace and swiftness, succubi can tear through hordes of foes with their scythe-like talons, often giggling uncontrollably while they play with their victims. Dancing gleefully away from larger opponents, they reserve their primary torments for those of similar proportions to their own.

succubi_tempters.name: Succubi Tempters
succubi_tempters.explicitoptions:
Mesmerising Plumage=3/model,
			Hidden Knives=4/model,
			Hot Blood=1/model,
			Kaleidoscopic Flesh=3/model,
			Hammer Hand=5/model,
succubi_tempters.fluff: Though many are not aligned to any of the Seven, succubi commonly follow Cibaresh the Tempter. Those dedicated to the God of Lust are permitted congress with His salacious pets: mounts artfully formed for symbiosis with their riders. These pairs of daemons are perfectly matched: one fleet and built for speed, the other adapted to ride its fragile form and deal death from its back with razor-sharp, steel-like claws.

threshing_engine.name: Threshing Engine
threshing_engine.explicitoptions:
Horns of Hubris=10[20]/model*,
			Whipcrack Tail=10[25]/model*,
			Mark of the Eternal Champion=40,
			Horrifying Visage=10[25]/model*,
			Hidden Knives=15[50]/model*,
threshing_engine.fluff: Hurtling across the field with unnatural speed, these daemonic contraptions can decimate enemy troops. Usually pulled by sleek, elongated bipeds and crewed by smaller fiends, these hellish chariots use seething, flesh-rending blades to create a nightmare imitation of agricultural practices.

throne_of_overwhelming_splendour_mount.name: Throne of Overwhelming Splendour
throne_of_overwhelming_splendour_mount.fluff: Reserved exclusively for the highest lieutenants of Savar, these spectacular constructs exude grandeur and unquestionable authority. They are pulled by exotic beasts from the Pride God’s menageries, and can hurtle out of the skies in devastating airborne attacks.

titanslayer_chariot.name: Titanslayer Chariot
titanslayer_chariot.explicitoptions:
Digestive Vomit=10,
			Golden Helm=5,
			Segmented Shell=5,
			Centipede Legs=15,
			Chitinous Scales=20,
titanslayer_chariot.fluff: This living engine, made of arcane metals and unnatural technologies, seeks the largest and most fearsome enemies before ramming itself as hard as possible into its enormous prey. It draws smaller daemons who cling to its chassis, aiding it in its mission of slaughter.

vanadras_scourge.name: Vanadra’s Scourge
vanadras_scourge.fluff: Towering icons of simmering rage and bestial fury, the greater daemons of Wrath are belligerent mountains of corded muscles, hurling themselves into battle on leathery wings. Scornful of all enemies, they await the attacks of their foes with a growing rage; when they finally strike back, there is almost nothing that can survive the ensuing carnage.

veil_serpents.name: Veil Serpents
veil_serpents.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spells from the following:
veil_serpents.fluff: Writhing through the air, seemingly part fish and part serpent, these Veil-attuned predators have no eyes nor other sensory organs, being simply drawn by a nameless hunger and an uncanny ability to locate new victims. They channel their otherworldly powers into spells that drain their prey’s strength and courage, while adapting their forms to the world as they require.

beast_giant.name: Beast Giant
beast_giant.optionalshootingweaponsdef:
Beer Barrel - Shooting Weapon

The model gains Looted Booze. One use only.
This weapon can be used as a Shooting Weapon with the following profile:
NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Beer Barrel28"140Accurate, Quick to Fire, Area Attack (3×3), March and Shoot


After this weapon has been used as a Shooting Weapon, the model loses Looted Booze.
beast_giant.fluff: Towering humanoids that make up in size what they lack in intellect, some giants have been known to follow migrating beast herds to sate the wanderlust in their hearts. For their part, the beasts are quick to accept the company and protection provided by these dim-witted but loyal allies and drinking partners.

briar_beast.name: Briar Beast
briar_beast.fluff: The magic arts of womb marking are dangerous, and failures are common. In rare cases, severely mutated offspring can survive, deformed beyond recognition. Normally condemned to a benevolent exile, they’re allowed to follow the herd if they stay out of sight. Such concealed monsters can be a great aid in battle, especially since their warped minds do not know fear – only loneliness.

centaur_chieftain.name: Centaur Chieftain
centaur_chieftain.leadership:
One choice only:,
			General=25,
			Battle Standard Bearer=75,
			Solitary=25,
			Captain and Attached=free,
centaur_chieftain.fluff: Fierce and charismatic, centaur chiefs combine their marking’s wild power and impulsive speed with the ability to keep their unruly kin in line, knowing precisely when and where to strike for maximum effect. When the battle horn sounds, they lead their troop on headlong charges, delighting in the thrill of combat and the debauchery and looting that inevitably follows.

centaurs.name: Centaurs
centaurs.fluff: Markings based on horses have never fully succeeded, but have produced a fused creature that can act as powerful cavalry. Imperfect birthing sorceries leave most centaurs suffering from chronic headaches that can only be remedied by prodigious quantities of alcohol. Rash and impulsive, their common inebriation both contributes to and detracts from their ability to wage war.

cyclops.name: Cyclops
cyclops.shootingweaponsdef:
Hurl Attack - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Hurl Attack424"173Artillery, Area Attack (2×2), Direct Hit(Multiple Wounds(2)), Divine Attacks,
cyclops.fluff: The rarest and riskiest womb markings are the titan beasts: behemothic brutes sometimes as large as an adult giant. Of these, the cyclops are wisest and most insightful. Their enchanted eye perceives much and can see far – both literally and metaphorically, so it’s said. Their calm demeanour and mighty throwing arms are invaluable when the herd needs to overcome fortified holdfasts.

feral_hounds.name: Feral Hounds
feral_hounds.fluff: Bred for strength and viciousness, these packs aren’t trained to blindly obey: the relationship between beast and hound is closer to symbiosis, and the dogs are encouraged to retain as much of their wild nature as possible. They provide the herds with security and companionship, and fight alongside them during hunts and battles, learning the same ambush strategies.

gargoyles.name: Gargoyles
gargoyles.fluff: A complex and difficult womb marking has given these beasts wings, but it often robs them of their reasoning. Those few who retain a higher intelligence are great assets in any herd; they can serve as long-range sentries, able to spot threats and assail them with vicious aerial strikes.

gortach.name: Gortach
gortach.fluff: A gortach is the result of ambitious and perilous womb-marking rituals involving large conclaves of soothsayers, intended to produce the ultimate war-beast as a protector for the herd. These horned, many-limbed giants can tear down walls and decimate infantry formations with frightening ease. In battle, they gorge themselves on their fallen foes, gaining strength from their lifeblood.

jabberwock.name: Jabberwock
jabberwock.fluff: Whenever a herd finds the unattended nest of a griffon or hippogriff, the soothsayers mark the stolen eggs, attempting to create a jabberwock. These mutant avian enormities have a sense of wrongness about them, as if their very existence is an affront to nature. On the battlefield, their clucking, screeching descent can rout even the most resolute of warriors.

longhorn_herd.name: Longhorn Herd
longhorn_herd.fluff: The greatest warriors typically have the most impressive horns, and those granted the rank of Longhorn also carry the best arms and armour that the herd can provide. They are fiercely loyal, often forming a private wartribe for their leader, and in his name they break any army that stands in the herd’s path.

minotaur_chieftain.name: Minotaur Chieftain
minotaur_chieftain.leadership:
,
			Captain and Attached=free,
			Solitary=30,
			General=30,
			Battle Standard Bearer=80,
minotaur_chieftain.fluff: The chieftains of the ox-men, these renowned butchers represent their comrades within a warherd. Possessing both the strength and temperament to commit bloodthirsty savagery, their lowing call can be heard across the field of battle, demoralizing the foe and rallying their kin.

minotaurs.name: Minotaurs
minotaurs.fluff: An ancient womb marking descended from the most ill-tempered cattle, minotaurs remain quick to anger when threatened or opposed. Their strength and size make them ideal shock troops, and they’re often found in the warherd’s vanguard, leading the charge and gorging themselves on the bloodied corpses of their fallen adversaries.

minotaur_warlord.name: Minotaur Warlord
minotaur_warlord.fluff: The greatest of the minotaurs, these colossal half-bulls are even more belligerent than other beasts when battle is joined. If their herd is threatened or they’re roused to anger, these avatars of bloodshed will let their restraint fall away, madly goring and trampling their enemies in a compulsive orgy of death.

mongrel_herd.name: Mongrel Herd
mongrel_herd.fluff: Those born to parents from incompatible womb markings tend to be diminutive compared to others. With the characteristics of multiple species, many are nonetheless skilled and experienced fighters, strong or cunning enough to survive and thrive despite the many dangers of life in a warherd.

mongrel_raiders.name: Mongrel Raiders
mongrel_raiders.fluff: Warriors that have taken up the bow to create particularly sudden and devastating raids, these expert scouts operate in the wild to identify sources of food and water, obstacles to the herd’s path, and inhabited areas to avoid or target. In battle, they can harass and hinder enemies, appearing just where they’re least expected or welcome.

raiding_chariots.name: Raiding Chariots
raiding_chariots.fluff: For the nomadic beast herds, wagons and other wheeled vehicles can be an indispensable mode of transportation for both beasts and their baggage. These constructs can be modified for battle, drawn by truculent beasts of burden and used to devastating effect in times of war.

razortusk_chariot.name: Razortusk Chariot
razortusk_chariot.fluff: Only the bravest of beasts possess the audacity and strength of will to tame a fully-grown razortusk and lash it to a sturdy chariot. Those that succeed enjoy greater status within the herd and are given a place of honour in the vanguard. They’re trusted with a sacred warhorn to signal the charge, filling nearby beasts with a primal ferocity.

razortusk_herd.name: Razortusk Herd
razortusk_herd.fluff: Oversized boars with serrated tusks, these colossal porcine beasts are the product of womb marking that has enhanced size and territorial instincts, though it’s yet to produce intelligence or a bipedal stature. Trained to despise the beasts’ enemies, their squealing, thunderous charge is akin to a force of nature, shattering formations with sheer momentum.

soothsayer.name: Soothsayer
soothsayer.fluff: Able to walk the paths of both warherd and hidden herd, those who can master the primal magecraft of the beasts act as storytellers, guides, and womb markers, shaping the herds’ destiny. Some advise the chiefs, while others take the mantle of leadership directly. In battle, their wild magics prove that arcane might is not the exclusive domain of sheltered scholars.

wildhorn_chieftain.name: Wildhorn Chieftain
wildhorn_chieftain.leadership:
,
			General=25,
			Battle Standard Bearer=75,
			Captain and Attached=free,
			Solitary=25,
wildhorn_chieftain.fluff: War leaders of smaller herds or trusted kin-beasts of herd commanders, many chiefs willingly accept the supremacy of a regional beast born lord. They direct portions of the herd in his absence, or have the honour of bearing the totems of the greatest heroes of the past, striking fear into the hearts of the foe and inspiring ferocity in their fellows.

wildhorn_herd.name: Wildhorn Herd
wildhorn_herd.fluff: Horns are symbols of great pride to fighting beasts, and those who have proven themselves worthy in battle are given a title that is normally translated as Wildhorn. Tough and hardy, they are veterans of raid and ambush. When the warherd is brought to battle, they form large mobs that stampede towards the enemy.

wildhorn_lord.name: Wildhorn Lord
wildhorn_lord.fluff: Warherds are normally led by the mightiest warriors or those whose legend has grown the greatest. Known for savage cunning, they scorn convoluted stratagems, preferring instead to trust on instinct. Many a civilised foe has been left broken beneath the cloven hooves of a beast born lord they underestimated.

altar_of_battle_mount.name: Altar of Battle
altar_of_battle_mount.fluff: Sonnstahl’s most zealous clergy sometimes go to battle in great pomp, riding large and frightening chariots, declaiming violent tirades against Sunna’s enemies. Such a sight can inspire soldiers to fury and enhance their assaults with magical potency. Often equipped with powerful arcane instruments, these constructs enact divine judgement with deadly spellcraft.

arcane_engine.name: Arcane Engine
arcane_engine.fluff: Elaborate wheeled platforms bearing magically charged artefacts, ancient tomes or other items harnessing the energies of the Veil, these potent mechanisms are towed into battle by mighty war horses. Combining the best of science and magecraft, chariot and enchantment, they are both physically and magically dangerous, greatly augmenting the army’s fighting prowess.

artificer.name: Artificer
artificer.fluff: Sonnstahl’s military academies recruit the finest minds to develop and operate the empire’s most formidable weaponry. Many such artificers are regarded as somewhat strange by their comrades due to their soot-covered clothing, indecipherable muttering and common deafness, but few doubt their impact on the battlefield.

wizard.name: Battlefield Wizard
wizard.fluff: The study of the Veil and its manipulation is no idle pastime for the wizards of Sonnstahl. Trained by famous colleges of magic known for great learning and even greater rivalries, they’re often immersed in the world of academia, but only those with the proper aptitudes and control of their art are approved for battle.

artillery.name: Blackpowder Artillery
artillery.fluff: Thanks to first-rate engineering guilds and military academies, the Imperial Armoury now boasts a varied collection of black powder weapons capable of devastating ranged attacks. By exploding rocket or mortar bomb, hails of solid shot or a single mighty cannonball hurled across the battlefield, the Empire’s greatest enemies have rightly learned to fear these death-dealing contraptions.

commanding_dragon_mount.name: Commanding Dragon
commanding_dragon_mount.fluff: Undisputed kings of beasts, dragons are seldom willing to accept a rider. In Sonnstahl that opportunity is truly rare, and those who succeed in gaining such a creature’s regard soon find themselves in great favour with the imperial throne, if they weren’t already. Orders punctuated with the roar of a dragon can change the course of a battle.

electoral_cavalry.name: Electoral Cavalry
electoral_cavalry.fluff: While the lower classes fight on foot, wealthier citizens, when called to war, are commonly found mounted on heavily armoured war horses. Such regiments are usually maintained by Electors – those who participate in votes for a new Emperor. These cavaliers claim to bring a sense of class to what would otherwise be merely a vulgar brawl.

flagellants.name: Flagellants
flagellants.fluff: The most pious Sunnans are sometimes radicalised by the Goddess's more extreme cults. Taught to show devotion and repentance through bodily harm – both to themselves and those judged as Sunna’s enemy – they often join Sonnstahl’s armies uninvited. Their aid is not turned away, for they are formidable in battle: with nothing but faith for armour, they’re incapable of fear.

great_griffon_mount.name: Great Griffon
great_griffon_mount.fluff: Griffons left to grow to full size develop wings large enough to fly. They are challenging to master but tremendously powerful assets in battle, kept only by those with the strongest will.

horse_mount.name: Horse
horse_mount.fluff: The military value of cavalry has long been recognised in Sonnstahl, and the imperial army maintains a closely guarded breeding stock of warhorses in addition to the private mounts of those who can afford them.

imperial_guard.name: Imperial Guard
imperial_guard.fluff: Selected from the ranks, the most proven of Sonnstahl’s soldiers have signed on for an extended period of military service, as the guards of key places and people. Highly skilled and superbly equipped, these forces are reputed for their loyalty as much as their deadly skills.

imperial_rangers.name: Imperial Rangers
imperial_rangers.fluff: Commonly deployed on Sonnstahl’s frontiers, rangers monitor the most empty and perilous regions of the Empire. Experts in the many dangers of the wilderness, they’re particularly familiar with monstrous animals. Firing with twice the speed of a typical archer, they know exactly where to place their arrows; those who didn’t have left their bones in the wilds.

inquisitor.name: Inquisitor
inquisitor.fluff: Answering to the Supreme Prelate herself, inquisitors are charged with rooting out insidious elements within imperial society. Cultists, vampiric thralls and those who simply ask too many questions are all prey to these steely-eyed killers. Dressed in simple, well-worn black clothing recognisable to any Sonnstahler, in battle they’re feared for their expertise in the arts of death-dealing.

knight_commander.name: Knight Commander
knight_commander.fluff: These leaders rise from the ranks of the Knightly Orders. A prerequisite is sponsorship or inherited wealth to facilitate the cost of armour and mounts, but these gifted warriors are no armoured peacocks. Veterans of a host of battles, they’re chosen for their leadership and fighting prowess.

knightly_orders.name: Knightly Orders
knightly_orders.fluff: Warriors who have shown their mettle and enacted great deeds on the battlefield may be granted the honour of joining an order. Such fellowships rely on a set of core principles and beliefs, and are entrusted with special tasks by imperial powers. The most famous is the Order of the White Eye, which oversees the vital defences of the Beacons on Sonnstahl’s eastern border.

knights_of_the_sun_griffon.name: Knights of the Sun Griffon
knights_of_the_sun_griffon.fluff: Claiming to have been founded in the days of Sunna herself, the Fellowship of the Sun Griffon is perhaps the most prestigious order of knights in Sonnstahl. Today, its members exclusively ride griffons, giving them a deadly advantage in the fray. With vicious talons and beaks, these mounts provide a devastating platform for their skilled masters.

state_militia.name: Local Militia
state_militia.fluff: In times of need, citizens can be called upon to band together as local militias. Many are former soldiers, others farmers or even city gangs. Armed with a wider range of weapons than conventional soldiers, these conscripts lack vital training, but they can still harry the enemy with unorthodox manoeuvres.

marshal.name: Marshal
marshal.leadership:
, Captain and Attached=free, Solitary=30, General, Imperial Authority, and +1 Dis=45, Battle Standard Bearer
and Imperial Authority=60, Great Tactician
(Model with Imperial Authority only)=50, Imperial Prince (General only)=65,
marshal.fluff: Imperial Marshals are professional soldiers schooled in the art of war. Some are talented nobles born to lead, others are grizzled veterans from the ranks, but all are gifted in strategy and tactics. The only other qualifications are an unshakable loyalty to Sunna and the Emperor, and the ability to inculcate devotion in their troops.

pegasus_mount.name: Pegasus
pegasus_mount.fluff: Taming wild Vetian pegasi is no easy task; it’s said that the mount chooses the rider. Those that pass these noble beasts’ exacting scrutiny soar above their less favoured brethren into battle.

prelate.name: Prelate
prelate.fluff: These ministers of the Goddess and Sonnstahl’s other churches are as adept from the pulpit as they are in melee: both occasions calling for lengthy recitals of the holy books. Lovers of fire, brimstone and the destruction of heretics, such battle priests develop a powerful connection to their deities, using exhortations somewhere between spells and prayers to bless the troops.

reiters.name: Reiters
reiters.fluff: Scouting and patrolling ahead of imperial armies, reiters are able to harass and outmanoeuvre enemy soldiers with fast steeds and strong weapons. Their ranks are drawn from all walks of life, and it’s common to see younger nobles and those of much less elevated birth riding together.

state_infantry.name: State Infantry
state_infantry.fluff: Ranged support is a cornerstone of Sonnstahl’s military method. Powerful crossbows combine a tremendous range with the ability to skewer even the toughest hide. New black powder technology is increasingly available as well, able to punch solid shot through even the best armour.

steam_tank.name: Steam Tank
steam_tank.fluff: The zenith of Sonnstahl’s technological arts is the new steel behemoth known as the steam tank. Powered by ingenious engines, these impenetrable hulks roll into battle gouting steam and promising death. Equipped with powerful artillery, the machine is terrifying both close up and from afar, though its pilots are frequently prone to various forms of madness and obsession.

young_griffon_mount.name: Young Griffon
young_griffon_mount.fluff: Combining eagle and lion, the griffon remains a terrifying predator in the wild, though those ridden in battle have been bred in captivity. While commonly called young, these smaller griffons are those that have been neutered in their first year to limit growth and make them easier to train.

ancient_dragon_mount.name: Ancient Dragon
ancient_dragon_mount.fluff: These mighty winged behemoths are older than history, remembering the time before the Great Cataclysm. Such creatures are even more selective than their kin about their riders; to enter into a pact with an ancient dragon is equivalent to gathering an army. Rare is the foe that dares to challenge such a covenant.

citizen_archers.name: Citizen Archers
citizen_archers.fluff: Those who are called by the levy are expected to learn both spear and bow, but in times of war, individuals will use the weapon with which they’re most skilled. With a calm that comes from long years of experience, the farsighted archers of the Arandai rain death on the enemies of the White Queen.

citizen_spears.name: Citizen Spears
citizen_spears.fluff: While they may be potters, poets or painters in their daily life, all Highborn are required to answer the levy when the time comes. Armed and trained by the state, they form the bulk of the uniformed ranks of the Empire’s glittering hosts. Let not their name deceive you: long-lived as they are, elves have much time to hone their skill.

commander.name: Commander
commander.leadership:
,
			General=20,
			Battle Standard Bearer=70,
			Captain and Attached=free,
			Solitary=20,
commander.fluff: Hailing from the commoners and lesser nobility, these career soldiers of the Empire are sworn either directly to the Pearl Throne or one of the greater feudal lords. Masters of both combat and strategy, they’re the leaders upon which Highborn armies rely.

regal_dragon_mount.name: Regal Dragon
regal_dragon_mount.fluff: The mountains of Rymâ in the heart of Celeda Ablan are home to the greatest dragon lairs in the world. The magnificent wyrms that dwell here are particularly attuned to magic, and have long bonded with the elves of the White Isles. Their goals and aspirations match those of the Arandai more often than any other people, apart from other dragons.

elein_reavers.name: Erlein Reavers
elein_reavers.fluff: The most rustic of all the vassals of the White Queen, the scions of the swaying grasslands of Erlë are horsemasters and outriders, called reavers for their role in ancient conflicts. Employed by commanders across the length and breadth of the Empire, their speed and manoeuvrability have been instrumental in winning countless campaigns.

he_elven_horse_mount.name: Elven Horse
he_elven_horse_mount.fluff: Thousands of years of careful selection from across the four corners of the world have resulted in steeds with the qualities most appreciated by elves. While they’re not known for raw strength, no other horse can match their speed.

flame_wardens.name: Flame Wardens
flame_wardens.fluff: Air, water and fire are the sacred elements of the Arandai. Each has its own servants, with Flame Wardens charged as guardians of the latter. Anointed and imbued with supernatural warding through the consumption of the scorching contents of a phoenix egg, they see themselves as the protectors of civilisation, accepting shorter lives as the price of their holy duty.

giant_eagles.name: Giant Eagles
giant_eagles.fluff: Since before the dawn of history, elves have shared a rare friendship with the most powerful birds of prey. When the ancestors of the Arandai first left the forest, they were followed by their avian allies. To this day, eagles and elves fight side by side, and the deadliness of these aerial predators has not waned over the millennia.

grey_watchers.name: Grey Watchers
grey_watchers.fluff: Recruiting from the orphanages of Celeda Ablan, this clandestine organisation is the long hand of the Pearl Throne. Its operatives act as the Queen’s eyes and ears the world over. In war, they can serve as infiltrators and sappers, aiming to disorient and enfeeble the foe before the battle starts using ensorcelled weapons and lethal archery.

griffon_mount.name: Griffon
griffon_mount.fluff: As deadly as they are majestic, these proud half-lion, half-eagle beasts are akin in spirit and demeanour to the elves they befriend and fight alongside. Raised in the wild and later captured and trained, they can become vicious whirlwinds of wing, talon and beak, capable of shredding any who dare to stand against them.

highborn_lancers.name: Highborn Lancers
highborn_lancers.fluff: It’s both an honour and a responsibility of the noble houses of the Arandai to raise and equip a troop of mounted warriors. Recruited from noble-born and commoners of the household alike, they are a sight to behold. Polished mail and tall lances bedecked in pennons proudly proclaim these cavaliers’ martial prowess.

high_prince.name: High Prince
high_prince.fluff: Paragons of the Arandai way, Highborn nobles are taught from a young age to excel in their chosen path. With poise and precision, they lead by example, striving to perform mighty deeds worthy of song. Though elegant and captivating in appearance, woe betide those who underestimate them, mistaking a sense of style for incompetence.

initiate_of_the_fiery_heart.name: Initiate of the Fiery Heart
initiate_of_the_fiery_heart.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spells from the following:
initiate_of_the_fiery_heart.fluff: To be awarded the Order of the Fiery Heart by the Queen, one must master energy and matter. In their pursuit of that goal, many postulants seek draconic knowledge, forming formidable partnerships. These enthusiastic researchers are a welcome sight to the armies of Celeda Ablan, their spellcraft augmented by the innate and ancestral knowledge of their fiery mount.

knights_of_ryma.name: Knights of Rymâ
knights_of_ryma.fluff: Proud even for elves, this order of lancers from the noble houses of Rymâ forms the shock troops of the Pearl Throne. Among the world’s most powerful cavalry warriors, their very approach strikes fear into the hearts of many foes, and their armour is said to be moulded by the magefire of the dragons with whom they share the province.

lion_chariot.name: Lion Chariot
lion_chariot.fluff: To ride a chariot of Dyaran’s cult is a sign of tremendous prestige among the Lion Guard and the nobles of Ê’Baleg. They’re pulled by majestic predatory felines, which once roamed the White Isles but are now captured from overseas. The honour is even greater for those who can employ such a deadly union of warrior and beast in their service.

lion_guard.name: Lion Guard
lion_guard.fluff: Hailing from the windswept moors of Ê’Baleg, these disciples of Dyaran – the islands’ first and greatest warrior-hero – are renowned across the Empire as the finest monster hunters and bodyguards pearls can buy. Clad in a panoply emulating the legendary hero and wielding mighty axes, they have a reputation for hardy fearlessness.

mage.name: Mage
