mage.fluff: Supreme savants of the esoteric arts, schooled in the finest institutions of learning, and with access to the world’s most expansive libraries, elven wizards are masters of the arcane, and constantly in pursuit of new knowledge. The magical might they bring to the armies of Celeda Ablan can be used to tremendous effect.

phoenix.name: Phoenix
phoenix.toggles:
printoffensename
		onecolprintmodelrulesdef
		twocolprintmodelrulesdef
		onecolprintoptionalmodelrulesdef
		twocolprintoptionalmodelrulesdef
		onecolprintoptions
		twocolprintoptions
phoenix.fluff: Seen as living embodiments of fire, these giant hawks can summon magical flames and reincarnate after death. The eggs of these legendary creatures are acquired by Flame Wardens at great peril from distant lands, and raised with utmost respect. Unhatched eggs can be merged with supernals in dangerous rituals, turning the flames of a chick to biting frost.

queens_guard.name: Queen’s Guard
queens_guard.fluff: An elite battalion of exclusively female warriors, this cadre is dedicated to the protection of the White Queen, the royal family and all their possessions, as well as serving as Her Majesty’s heralds beyond the White Isles. Trained in the use of bow, sword and spear by the finest tutors, they’re the most dedicated and versatile specialists within the Empire.

reaver_chariots.name: Reaver Chariots
reaver_chariots.fluff: While nobles of other provinces train mounted knights, those of Erlë construct squadrons of swift chariots to send to war. With bow and lance, they complement the province’s roving bands of horseback reavers by trampling any opposition that their lighter comrades cannot overcome.

sea_guard.name: Sea Guard
sea_guard.fluff: The Sea Guard Corps is the standing army of the Empire, directly loyal to the throne. It’s tasked with manning the ships of the Royal Navy, garrisoning local fortresses, and protecting far flung outposts. Drilled in the use of spear and bow beyond their levied kin, these soldiers form the first line of defence of the White Isles and its colonies.

sea_guard_reaper.name: Sea Guard Reaper
sea_guard_reaper.shootingweaponsnote: This Shooting Weapon can be fired in two ways:

sea_guard_reaper.fluff: Elegant weapons, these bolt throwers are the principal artillery of the Arandai. They’re exclusively operated by the Sea Guard Corps, ensuring the Imperial Council has a monopoly on destructive constructs. Whether positioned on the deck of a ship or a fortress parapet, they’re works of art as much as instruments of death.

sky_sloop.name: Sky Sloop
sky_sloop.shootingweaponsdef:
Sky Reaper - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Sky Reaper324"453Quick to Fire
sky_sloop.fluff: Pulled by enormous flying warbirds, these support craft of the Royal Navy are so fine and lightweight that they can soar through the air itself, using nothing more than sails and minor enchantments. Often used as scouts, they can strike at enemy lines of communication, pester opposing troops, and cause havoc wherever they’re deployed.

sky_sloop_mount.name: Sky Sloop
sky_sloop_mount.shootingweaponsdef:
Sky Reaper - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Sky Reaper124"453Quick to Fire

sword_masters.name: Sword Masters
sword_masters.fluff: The most famous of all the soldiers of Celeda Ablan are those of the Order of the Sword Masters, also known as Paladins of Nab. They are warrior aesthetes par excellence, sometimes dubbed “blade poets” and “painters in red”. Once shunned for embracing the “beauty” of the War Crow, a goddess beloved of dread elves, they’re now a common sight in many armies.

damsel.name: Damsel
damsel.fluff: The most beloved servants of the Lady are the Damsels. Taught in secret schola hidden away from society, they delve deep into the higher mysteries. Straddling truth and secret, light and shadow, in and out of society, guiding but not leading, revered and loved but held at distance, these exclusively female mages learn much but tell little.

destrier_mount.name: Destrier
destrier_mount.fluff: The finest and strongest horses, those bred and trained specifically for war, are called destriers, and nowhere are they found in such numbers and such quality as in Equitaine. The pride of knights and lords alike, these noble beasts are in large part responsible for the kingdom’s military strength.

duke.name: Duke
duke.fluff: The masters of the realms, serving under the king, are its dukes. These feudal lords can command great hosts, and are often savvy statesmen. Trained from the cradle to the grave, they can both fight and lead, embracing the principles laid down by Uther and the Green Knight.

enlisted_outlaws.name: Enlisted Outlaws
enlisted_outlaws.fluff: Seeking remission for their crimes or a release from traditional feudal contracts, Equitaine’s rugged outlaws may agree to fight for lords willing to grant them pardon. Harrying enemies with keen shooting and stalking unseen in the wilds, they are an effective if irregular scout force.

fey_knight.name: Fey Knight
fey_knight.fluff: Just as mortal knights to a lord, the knights of the Realm Beyond are sworn to greater fey. Some serve a Courtier, and others one of the five Fey Paramount. Majestic, otherworldly beings and peerless fighters, they are said to have taught humans the secrets of chivalry and war, and guard the sacred places where the Veil is thinnest.

fey_steed_mount.name: Fey Steed
fey_steed_mount.fluff: The mythic horses that dwell in the Lady’s Realm are seen in the material world only when ridden by the supernal entourage of the Evermaiden. But in exceptional circumstances, truly worthy mortals have also earned or tamed such a mount. From nuckelavees to kelpies and brags, some resemble mundane horses, others are more fantastical. All are mysterious and magically warded.

folk_hero.name: Folk Hero
folk_hero.fluff: In the land of heroes, even the lowest born can reach heights of renown and glory. A motley assortment from all walks of life, these brave folk fight with cunning and courage. From the shadowy Quin who serve the Trickster god, to the dour castellans who protect all who live within their estates, any of stout heart can answer the kingdom’s call.

friars_lantern.name: Friar’s Lantern
friars_lantern.fluff: The lesser fey are mischievous and dangerous to the unwary. From ghostly apparitions to ethereal, disembodied lights – and many other guises besides – these illusory beings play tricks to guide the foolish to ruin.

hedge_knights.name: Hedge Knights
hedge_knights.fluff: These knights are often the younger sons of the nobility, or other landless warriors who have not attained a permanent place in a lord’s retinue. Typically young and headstrong, they favour agile cob mounts that give them speed over safety, and throw themselves into every fray to prove their valour and secure a place.

heraldic_steed_mount.name: Heraldic Steed
heraldic_steed_mount.fluff: Equitaine is home to many strange creatures; some are suitable for riding even if they’re not large enough to become knightly mounts. Perytons – part eagle, part deer – are particularly prized for their agility, among other winged combinations. Such animals are often depicted on coats of arms: valiant symbols of the Realm, descending upon enemies in a mighty storm.

hippogriff_mount.name: Hippogriff
hippogriff_mount.fluff: The largest of the mortal mounts commonly used by Equitans in battle, hippogriffs are ferocious beasts combining the front half of an eagle and the back half of a horse. Powerful both over ground and in the air, the cost of their breeding and maintenance means that only the lords of the land can feasibly afford to keep such a prized animal.

knights_of_the_court.name: Knights of the Court
knights_of_the_court.fluff: Dukes claim the allegiance of dozens, often hundreds of knights. Their courts are a bustle of politics and intrigue, with frequent contests of arms. The greatest knights, their mettle tested in battles and tourneys, may be chosen as close retainers, to remain permanently at court. Equipped with the finest arms, both mundane and magical, they can achieve supernatural feats of heroism on the field.

knights_of_the_quest.name: Knights of the Quest
knights_of_the_quest.fluff: These knights have set aside their status and ambition in the realms of men to take up the mantle of the Quest. Embracing hardship and toil, they must achieve great deeds of valour, often by slaying particular foes. Enduring many forms of encounter during their holy missions, these living martyrs choose to put aside the lance and rely on the versatility of large swords.

knights_of_the_realm.name: Knights of the Realm
knights_of_the_realm.fluff: The pride of Equitaine are its knights. Heavily armed and armoured, these first sons of the nobility are the prime focus and greatest asset in any lord’s military. Their mighty warhorses are the product of centuries of equestrian tradition, ensuring that Equitaine can count on better access to heavy cavalry than any other land.

knights_penitent.name: Knights Penitent
knights_penitent.fluff: Knights who have dishonored themselves are given leave to seek atonement through the three tenets of the faith, joining crusades or noble lords to wipe clean the stain on their souls. Their determination and ferocity is the surest path back, and their most feared aspect. They use the largest steeds and heaviest weapons, representing the weight of their sins.

lowborn_archers.name: Lowborn Archers
lowborn_archers.fluff: The tradition of archery has long been mandated in northern Equitaine, while in the south both longbow and crossbow are held in great esteem. Skilled bowmen command higher wages and privileges than their levied brethren, and are often exempt from the general toil of the camps, acting as perimeter guards and ranged support for the army.

lowborn_levies.name: Lowborn Levies
lowborn_levies.fluff: Part of the obligation laid upon the lower orders of Equitaine is some form of service to a local lord. Usually this is paid in labour, but in time of war, they may be brought to battle to support the lord’s knights, fight on foot, and fulfil the menial duties of which all armies are in need.

men-at-arms.name: Men-at-Arms
men-at-arms.fluff: Men-at-arms are Equitaine’s heavy infantry. Whether knights who have forgone a mount to atone for past failures, lowborn veterans chosen to defend a keep, or ordo warriors of particular distinction, these troops are the stout shield of the army. Able to hold firm in the press of melee, only a fool would discount them.

mounted_serjeants.name: Mounted Serjeants
mounted_serjeants.fluff: Not all who join the ordos are clerks, teachers and spiritual guides. Some of their number embrace the faith by joining in battle against the enemies of the Lady, bringing Her word to those who have yet to hear it. Their rounceys are superb all-purpose horses, fine steeds for war and peace alike.

naiads.name: Naiads
naiads.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spells from the following:
naiads.fluff: Followers of the Lady revere fresh water as a symbol of purity. Thus, among the many classes of fey in Her Court, the ladies of the lakes are the most numerous and respected. Mercurial, mystical and merciless, naiads were once supernals, but they have long been bonded to watery mortal forms.

paladin.name: Paladin
paladin.fluff: Since the earliest days of the kingdom, this unique ordo of knights has served the monarch directly. Its task is to seek out the followers of Night Lords, Dark Gods, and any who undermine the Realm. By book and blade, these knights are trained in the deep secrets of hunting the darkest forces of the world.

pegasus_charger_mount.name: Pegasus Charger
pegasus_charger_mount.fluff: These mounts are prized above all others in Equitaine, and with good reason. Among all the peoples of the world, only the Equitans have learned the secrets of breeding pegasi in captivity. From their origins at Whitewing’s Abbey, these winged steeds have carried the flower of Equitaine’s chivalry to victory in battle for generations.

pegasus_knights.name: Pegasus Knights
pegasus_knights.fluff: Traditionally an honour granted by the king, the use of a pegasus is a sign of great distinction for any knight. After choosing and bonding with the mount, they must train together and with fellow airborne knights for months or years before they reach their full potential in battle.

revered_unicorn_mount.name: Revered Unicorn
revered_unicorn_mount.fluff: While all horses are beloved by Equitans, the legendary unicorn is the only steed subject to outright worship. Intelligent beings able to cross the Veil at will, they rarely appear to mortals and only accept the Lady’s closest servants as riders. Magically connected to the natural world cherished by the Goddess, wild regions hold no dangers for a unicorn’s allies.

sacred_reliquary.name: Sacred Reliquary
sacred_reliquary.fluff: Monks, nuns, and all manner of zealous lowborn seek battle against the enemies of the Queen of Cups. Following holy leaders or popular causes, many bring the sacred relics of the faith with them into battle, including Sainted remains. Inspired by this proximity to the divine, they in turn incite the faithful to greater acts of piety and valour.

siege_war_machine.name: Siege Weapon
siege_war_machine.shootingweaponsdef:
Scorpion - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Scorpion448"1310Area Attack(1×5), Direct Hit(Str 6, Multiple Wounds(D3))


Trebuchet - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Trebuchet448"173Artillery,Area Attack(2×2), Direct Hit(Multiple Wounds(2))
siege_war_machine.fluff: The schools and libraries of the ordos produce learned acolytes skilled in logistics, architecture, and engineering. Some have mastered the creation of war machines like the onager, mangonel, trebuchet and scorpion, as well as the ballistics to use them in battle. These siege tools are a welcome addition to the arsenal of any lord.

sky_heralds.name: Sky Heralds
sky_heralds.fluff: The most trusted of a lord’s yeomen are his sky heralds. These retainers are charged with mastery of flying mounts which lack the strength to bear a fully armoured knight to the skies, but are nonetheless fierce and useful. Mount and master are cunning and clever, hunting enemies at the flanks and from above.

the_ladys_courtier.name: The Lady’s Courtier
the_ladys_courtier.fluff: These powerful fey are supernals in service to the Lady, and highly ranked within Her Court. Mighty in battle and spellcraft, they cross the Veil and aid Her faithful in times of strife. They have many forms, both noble and terrifying, each with their own servants and vassals among the fey.

yeoman_outriders.name: Yeoman Outriders
yeoman_outriders.fluff: Yeomen hold the highest position of soldiery allowed to the lowborn. These outriders are placed in charge of their lord’s riding horses and dogs, acting as patrolmen and vanguards; their own steeds are bred and famed for swiftness. Yeomen are given the best food and pay among the milites, and are sworn to permanent service to their lord’s household.

bombardiers.name: Bombardiers
bombardiers.shootingweaponsdef:
Hand Cannon - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Hand Cannon512"353Accurate, March and Shoot, Stand and Shoot, Quick to Fire
bombardiers.fluff: What might be used as a cannon by some can be fired by hand by a trained ogre, functioning as frighteningly powerful muskets. These weapons are often dedicated to Yakha, god of the mountains, with barrages intended to bury the enemy under an avalanche.

bruisers.name: Bruisers
bruisers.fluff: Those who show more aptitude and enthusiasm for fighting than their fellow tribesmen are soon given larger weapons and tougher armour to make them both more dangerous and able to withstand danger.

frost_mammoth.name: Frost Mammoth
frost_mammoth.fluff: Only found on the most remote northern tundra, the dreaded frost mammoth is said to be the living host of the soul of Dengrai’s icy storms. Able to magically manipulate the temperature in their vicinity, adult mammoths are exceedingly hard to capture and impossible to train, forcing hunters to target juveniles and raise them with the tribe.

great_khan.name: Great Khan
great_khan.fluff: Ogre steppe nomads have a highly developed respect for history and lineage. Largely inspired by the unbeatable armies of the ancient Qenghet Khan, certain tribal leaders seek to reclaim his position as Khagan: a khan of khans, lord of the steppe and the Gyengget. Those who harbour such ambition tend to be truly impressive in body, spirit and symbolic adornments.

khan.name: Khan
khan.leadership:
,
			General=35,
			Battle Standard Bearer=85,
			Solitary=30,
			Captain and Attached=free,
khan.fluff: It takes both strength and personal popularity to command an ogre tribe. The Khan is expected to lead their forces into battle as well as secure the tribe’s economic prosperity at all times. They must also continuously gauge the fealty, power and intentions of other khans in a never-ending political dance.

kin-eater.name: Kin-Eater
kin-eater.fluff: These creatures, mutated by the Wasteland, or descended from ogres who fled the Inferno, wander the mountains fending for themselves, minds and bodies twisted by over-exposure to magic. Some are even known to violate core taboos, earning the name kin-eater. Still, mountain ogres will overlook their actions and deformations if they’re willing to join in battle.

mammoth_hunter.name: Mammoth Hunter
mammoth_hunter.leadership:
May choose (one choice only):, General, Disciplined, and Wildheart=30, Battle Standard Bearer
(only if Wildheart is in Armylist)=50,
mammoth_hunter.fluff: Various species of mammoth can sometimes be captured in hugely prestigious hunting expeditions. Only the most skilled are successful in such hunts, if they can learn the ways of the world’s greatest beasts and how to overcome them with experience, will and intelligence. They often work with hunting animals with which they form inseparable bonds.

mercenary_gunners.name: Mercenary Gunners
mercenary_gunners.fluff: Ogre mercenaries with a proven talent for ranged weapons can often command better rates; their mighty physiques allow them to wield weapons far larger than normal humanoid soldiers, allowing their "light" troops to provide heavy barrages and crushing close quarters capability.

mercenary_veterans.name: Mercenary Veterans
mercenary_veterans.fluff: Ogres routinely offer their highly-sought services as escorts to merchants along the Silk Roads and beyond. In Arcalea and elsewhere, many even gather in formal mercenary companies, gaining experience of foreign weapons and tactics. Returning to their tribe, their new skills and equipment make them the most fearsome troops in many ogre armies.

rock_aurochs.name: Rock Aurochs
rock_aurochs.fluff: The Augean aurochs, sometimes called the cattle of the gods, can grow to titanic sizes on the steppe, surviving in a hostile environment thanks to a near-impenetrable hide some believe to be solid rock. Sacred to Umi, the cows are used for pulling, while the bulls’ temperament and horns make them an unstoppable force of nature in battle.

defenserules.name: Mountain Hide defenserules=Mountain Hide offensename=Rock Aurochs

sabretooth_tigers.name: Sabretooth Tigers
sabretooth_tigers.fluff: What would be targets of a hunt for other peoples are employed as hunting beasts by ogres. The giant cats of the Sky Mountains are particularly prized for their intelligence and strength. Many live among ogre tribes as valued pets and highly trained warbeasts, their fangs encouraged to grow to troubling size.

scraplings.name: Scraplings
scraplings.fluff: These small creatures may not look like much of a threat. But they not only rely on their ogre patrons for their livelihoods, they also fear their wrath if they disobey. This makes them eager to support their masters in battle, creating distractions for the enemy or peppering them with small weapons from a distance.

scrapling_trappers.name: Scrapling Trappers
scrapling_trappers.fluff: The tiny scraplings are faithful to the ogres they chose to serve and ruthless to their enemies. Those with particular talents are allowed to assist in hunting, their smaller forms better-suited to stealthily laying traps in advance of driven game. Many display an uncanny ingenuity for this devious work.

scratapult.name: Scratapult
scratapult.shootingweaponsdef:
Scratapult - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Scratapult448"141Artillery, Area Attack(3×3), Lethal Strike
scratapult.fluff: War machines that don’t require black powder are considered safe for operation by underlings. This does not make them less dangerous. Many scraplings show a reckless disregard for their own and anyone else’s safety, loading their artillery with every sharp piece of stone or metal they can find.

shaman.name: Shaman
shaman.fluff: Intentionally savage in appearance, shamans are a vital source of arbitration and spiritual guidance, but their ill-will is also feared. Exorcisms, talking with spirits, and reading auguries are common Umist customs, and some revere the fire god Galzhan. Trained by their predecessors, shamans learn powerful spells for both religious rites and for battle.

slave_giant.name: Mercenary Giant
slave_giant.fluff: Giants are well suited to cold or mountainous environments and have proven a useful addition to many tribes. Most giants try to imitate their host culture, and those who live with ogres often seek to assist in commercial ventures, learning the tribe’s love of wealth. Certain legendary giants have proven among the greatest mercenary bodyguards of all time.

thunder_cannon.name: Thunder Cannon
thunder_cannon.shootingweaponsdef:
Thunder Cannon - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Thunder Cannon448"152Artillery, Area Attack(1×3), Direct Hit(Str 10, AP 4, Multiple Wounds(D3+1))
thunder_cannon.fluff: The Qeng Dynasty was founded by Qenghet’s best remembered and most successful grandson Tengai Khan, the first ogre emperor of Tsuandan. Under his reign, Tsuandanese cannons were first adapted to ogre warcraft; since then, monstrous guns from many lands have been used, often carried by huge domesticated beasts such as woolly rhino.

tribesmen.name: Tribesmen
tribesmen.fluff: Though they do not seek war for its own sake, battle is common enough for any tribe; all ogres keep weapons and know how to use them. Almost always outnumbered, ogres can usually disrupt the familiar discipline of enemy armies with sheer weight of flesh.

tusker_mount.name: Tusker
tusker_mount.fluff: Somewhere between a pig and a rhino, these large Augean herd animals are called by a term literally translated as “tusker”. Their tusks are not only impressive weapons, but their use in both mating rituals and battle against the ogres’ enemies has made them something of a favoured talisman in ogre rituals and other activities.

tusker_cavalry.name: Tusker Cavalry
tusker_cavalry.fluff: Cavalry has long been prized on the steppe, and ogres around the world will try to deploy it whenever the appropriate riding beasts can be found. Tuskers are the most popular choice for this role; their bulk and their toothy armaments make for potent stampedes.

yetis.name: Yetis
yetis.fluff: A strange species of remote mountain dwellers that normally keeps itself hidden, yetis can be coaxed down to fight in exchange for supplies. As large as ogres, they’re adapted to their frozen mountaintops with long hair covering their bodies and the ability to absorb heat directly from other beings.

alpha_carnosaur_mount.name: Alpha Carnosaur
alpha_carnosaur_mount.fluff: Undisputed monarchs of the magna sauria, these apex predators are the most dangerous individuals in their ecosystem. Harnessed for battle, they are a truly terrible force to contend with; the biggest species – classified by naturalists as kings among lizards – are some of the most powerful hunters in the world, with jaws as large as any dragon’s.

anurarch_archmage.name: Anurarch Archmage
anurarch_archmage.fluff: Able to acquire and process information at astonishing rates, anurachs can achieve unsurpassed skill in wizardry, making them both valuable and dangerous. To make use of their great power and unique areas of expertise, anurarchs are allowed to participate in battle, but they’re strictly guarded at all times. Some are talented telepaths, a form of magic undiscovered by most species.

anurarch_wardens_mount.name: Anurarch Wardens
anurarch_wardens_mount.fluff: Even if an anurach’s extraordinary magecraft can help achieve Vitalist goals, many saurians fear they may hatch nefarious schemes if left unattended. In both peace and war, anurachs are always under “protection” by dedicated and heavily armed guards, who surround the lodestone platforms the archmages use for transportation, keeping a barrier between them and the outside world.

caiman_elders.name: Caiman Elders
caiman_elders.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spells from the following:
caiman_elders.fluff: Unlike other saurians, the long-lived caimans get larger and more fearsome as they age. The older members of their caste often become combat experts and veterans of many battles. Their hulking bodies grant them enormous strength to support their skill with – or without – weapons.

caiman_mentor.name: Caiman Mentor
caiman_mentor.fluff: Many caimans are contradictory by nature, exploring meditative pastimes while simultaneously developing a military ferocity for times of war. Those who have acquired a true mastery of combat are greatly to be feared – not only are they powerful in their own right, but they also learn the art of working alongside untrained warriors to augment their effectiveness in battle.

caiman_warriors.name: Caiman Warriors
caiman_warriors.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spell from the following:
caiman_warriors.fluff: Most caimans keep to themselves, though they’re happy to support their enclave with anything requiring physical strength. In battle they join with other caimans to create fearsome defensive gangs. Equally adept at attacking with large weapons or their own vicious hands and jaws, such crocodilian monsters are a daunting foe.

carnosaur.name: Carnosaur
carnosaur.fluff: Even the smallest carnosaur is a huge and ferocious animal. Many but not all species have diminutive arms, relying on their great bulk, long strides and gigantic jaws to overcome any opponent. The most common carnosaurs are true forces of nature, becoming frenzied killing machines once they smell blood.

mountain_pteradon_mount.name: Mountain Pteradon
mountain_pteradon_mount.fluff: Pteradons are the masters of the skies over many of the regions where the magna sauria dwell. Though somewhat lacking intelligence, they can easily be trained as highly mobile steeds. The hardiest species can be found in the dizzying eyries of Virentia’s mountains.

pouakai_sky_tyrant_mount.name: Pouakai Sky Tyrant
pouakai_sky_tyrant_mount.fluff: Though originally hailing from a little-known island off Virentia, this airborne titan has since been introduced to enclaves around the world, and has particularly thrived in the vast archipelago of Aotarakoa in the Southern Sunrise Sea. Dwarfing even the largest pteradons, the locals call it the pouakai, and many tales are told of its savage dominance of the sky.

pteradon_riders.name: Pteradon Riders
pteradon_riders.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spells from the following:
pteradon_riders.fluff: With easily domesticated mounts, pteradon riders make ideal couriers and reconnaissance agents. Though not suited to heavy combat, they can strafe enemies from above and draw them out of position with their expert manoeuvrability, and they can even perch comfortably upon larger beasts when they need to rest.

raptor_pack.name: Raptor Pack
raptor_pack.fluff: Fast, ferocious, scythe clawed, and intelligent enough to coordinate attacks, raptors are the ultimate pack hunting predators. They have proven ideal for training by saurians, to the extent that they can operate in battle without handlers. The deadliest species, often boasting extravagant neck frills, produce natural toxins that they’re able to project at startling distance.

raptor_riders.name: Raptor Riders
raptor_riders.fluff: The combination of saurian and raptor often proves even deadlier than the sum of its parts. Able to generate both the charging momentum of their cavalry counterparts in other lands and the terrifying hunting patterns of wild predators, they can take a terrible toll on any foe.

rhamphodon_riders.name: Rhamphodon Riders
rhamphodon_riders.fluff: This unique aerial predator is adapted to feed on thick-skinned reptiles, with long, sharpened mandibles capable of rending scaled hide or steel armour with equal ease. Rhamphodons are driven to maddened rampage when they sense vulnerable prey nearby, making them difficult to control in battle but devastating when unleashed on the right enemy.

saurian_raptor_mount.name: Saurian Raptor
saurian_raptor_mount.fluff: Preferring to eschew mammalian mounts, saurian armies rarely have access to horses. Raptors are the ideal alternative. Many different species are used, all of them terrifying and lethal.

saurian_swarms.name: Saurian Swarms
saurian_swarms.fluff: Many are surprised to learn that the saurians seen in battle are all female. A dimorphic species, saurian males are rarely larger than geckos or iguanas. Four legged and lacking intelligence, they often follow their larger mates in great numbers, and can be directed by certain scents to attack and overwhelm enemies with hundreds of small but venomous bites.

skink_guerrillas.name: Skink Guerrillas
skink_guerrillas.fluff: Saurian enclaves are carefully hidden from the outside world, but they may still be stumbled upon accidentally. Scouts and sentries therefore watch the paths to their secret entrances, remaining unseen and discreetly eliminating interlopers who come too far. Such tactics make these wardens a deadly force in battle, armed with natural poisons and able to evade almost any threat.

skink_hunters.name: Skink Hunters
skink_hunters.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spell from the following:
skink_hunters.fluff: Saurians are carnivores; while most food comes from domesticated flocks, this is often supplemented by hunting, especially while on campaign. Better able to quietly stalk prey, skinks are often superb hunters, and those who have developed these skills often use them to protect their enclaves and assist their armies by harassing enemies with death-dealing projectiles.

skink_veteran.name: Skink Veteran
skink_veteran.fluff: Though less physically dominant than their tegu comrades, skinks can undertake much the same role. Their remarkable nimbleness and ability to master a range of vicious reptilian mounts helps them fill an essential niche in battle, and some are experts in guerrilla tactics.

skink_warriors.name: Skink Warriors
skink_warriors.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spell from the following:
skink_warriors.fluff: Equally untaught, skinks are the tegus’ equals in saurian society, but on the battlefield they intuitively find their own niche, putting their greater speed and agility to good use. Able to use simple weapons to great effect, they provide a potent counterpoint to their larger sisters and pets.

stygiosaur_pack.name: Stygiosaur Pack
stygiosaur_pack.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spells from the following:
stygiosaur_pack.fluff: Stygiosaurs are a family of large and terrifying predators. Most species are aquatic and use venom to immobilise their prey. Just as intelligent as raptors but more prone to bloodlust, they’re entrusted only to expert reptile handlers, working in packs to savage effect.

taurosaur.name: Taurosaur
taurosaur.fluff: Making the earth shake as they hurtle forwards, taurosaurs are behemothic herd animals known for aggression and territoriality. Once roused, they can send many tons of furious flesh – behind a great hardened crest of enormous spiked horns – at alarming speed towards any target chosen by its riders, and they’re often adorned with great wooden platforms to carry arcane weaponry.

tegu_guards.name: Tegu Guards
tegu_guards.fluff: Selected for watchfulness and skill, these saurians are permanent guards – or perhaps jailors – for an enclave’s anurarchs. Most saurians have little interest in arms or armour, but these tegu use hefty clubs inspired by Aotarakoan humans, as well as bones, gold, and other materials for rudimentary protection, laced with magic-absorbing obsidian to negate the spells of any anurarch that might turn against them.

tegu_mystics.name: Tegu Mystics
tegu_mystics.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spells from the following:
tegu_mystics.fluff: The Collaboration enclave on the island of Patarang is known for its jade palaces and experimental meditative techniques, practised by monastic (though non-religious) saurians. These eldritch spiritualists have developed a unique form of elegant, unhurried martial arts that incorporates simple spellcasting – arts that have spread somewhat through the wider Collaboration.

tegu_veteran.name: Tegu Veteran
tegu_veteran.fluff: Saurians have no standing military or trained warriors, but certain individuals sometimes demonstrate an outstanding knack for war. These outliers selflessly shoulder the burden of military organisation, strategy and frontline assignments, though they have no formal authority. Volunteering for any warparty, their experience makes them tremendously dangerous in the fray.

tegu_warriors.name: Tegu Warriors
tegu_warriors.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spell from the following:
tegu_warriors.fluff: While they lack traditional training, saurians are hatched with an instinct for ferocity in battle. Their Vitalists beliefs, normally inclining them to peace, make them eager and passionate volunteers once committed to war. Tegu in particular form a brutal centrepiece for any saurian offensive, each providing up to seven feet of armoured muscle, with sharpened claws, teeth and tail.

thyroscutus_herd.name: Thyroscutus Herd
thyroscutus_herd.fluff: The distinguishing trait of all species of thyroscutia is an impressively thick hide or shell. At least as large as cattle and many times heavier, these herbivores can carry great loads, including engines of war, and provide valuable cover for nearby troops. Species used in battle typically feature enormous clubbed or spiked tails that can fell much larger aggressors.

titanopod.name: Titanopod
titanopod.fluff: Likely the largest mortal beings in existence, titanopods can reach godly size, with necks and tails making them longer than the largest ocean-going vessels. Rarely noticing what lies under their tremendous hooves, they plough serenely through any obstacle, leaving nothing but flattened ruin in their wake.

weapon_beasts.name: Weapon Beasts
weapon_beasts.fluff: Certain smaller examples of the magna sauria can attack or defend themselves at range, discharging gouts of fire or shards of their own bones – both abilities exploited by saurians for military purposes. Hating fire, saurians are particularly keen that salamanders are pointed in a direction where their undesirable jets of flame can at least do some good.

avatar_of_nature.name: Avatar of Nature
avatar_of_nature.fluff: The rarest and oldest tree spirits can remember a time before they were imprisoned in mortal form. Maddened by an endless quest for lost freedom, kin and habitat, they’ve become the wrath of nature incarnate, more restless and warlike than any other tree spirit. Gargantuan, unstoppable juggernauts of wood, vines and roots, avatars hold the memories of entire forests.

blade_dancers.name: Blade Dancers
blade_dancers.fluff: These elves have given their lives to the reverie of the dance of Cenyrn, the trickster god: be it slow, joyful or terrifying. All who follow the path of the dancer are fey-like in movement, appearing as if the very air is glamoured. By preserving the ancient arts and traditions of their people, they become a graceful but deadly force in battle.

briar_maidens.name: Briar Maidens
briar_maidens.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spells from the following:
briar_maidens.shootingweaponsdef:
Poisoned Thorn - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Poisoned Thorn312"131Poison Attacks, Quick to Fire, Stand and Shoot
briar_maidens.fluff: Raised as the handmaidens of the Forest Queen, the sisters of this perilous order seek to nurture and heal the woods in Her name. It’s easy to forget the thorns their beauty hides, but their venom-dipped weapons will soon remind you. For these maidens are trained as lethal warrior-mages, and like their mistress, their temper is feared by all.

chieftain.name: Chieftain
chieftain.leadership:
,
			General=30,
			Battle Standard Bearer=80,
			Solitary=30,
			Captain and Attached=free,
chieftain.fluff: Tribal leaders and elders of renown, chieftains are champions and messengers. Usually leading smaller groups of Trewi, or forming part of the council of a larger assembly, they are always at the front and where the fight is thickest.

forest_dragon_mount.name: Forest Dragon
forest_dragon_mount.fluff: Dragons are the most revered of forest hunters. Known for pride, they possess unfathomable minds and ambiguous motives, selecting alliances with riders they deem worthy. Those dragons which dwell in a forest often become attuned to its soul, able to call to the very trees. They sometimes make their lairs in hidden groves that they tend and protect as others guard their hoards.

druid.name: Druid
druid.fluff: Creatures of twilight and primal lore, druids are expert spell weavers. Their powers stem not from a regimented study of the mystical arts, but from a deeper connection with the forest. Though not all follow the Path of Druidism, their spells confound the enemy and embolden their allies by tapping the secrets and the strength of the trees.

dryad_ancient.name: Dryad Ancient
dryad_ancient.fluff: Elder dryads have seen acorns grow into the tallest trees. They’re related to more lithe and fast-growing arboreal species than most treefathers, but can be deadly and mercurial in their own fashion. Their affinity for magic also connects them to younger Sylvan spirits of their own kind through a singular root network.

dryads.name: Dryads
dryads.fluff: These forest spirits embody the fickle nature of the seasons, for their shape is not fixed as it is for mortals. In one moment they might appear as fey elven maidens, but in another they become thorny bark and branches, vengeful and vicious, paying with the same coin to those who harm the natural world.

se_elven_horse_mount.name: Elven Horse
se_elven_horse_mount.fluff: Fast, nimble and reliable, the steeds favoured by the Sylvan elves are uniquely capable of navigating forest terrain.

eagle_king_mount.name: Forest Eagle
eagle_king_mount.fluff: Majestic creatures, bigger still than any giant kestrel, the royal eagles are truly the finest of avian species. Their friendship does not come lightly, but once given, it’s never rescinded.

forest_eagles.name: Forest Eagles
forest_eagles.fluff: Enormous birds of prey that vary in colour and size based on their environment, these lords of the forest share a wedge-shaped tail, powerful talons, and a hooked beak. Whether ridden or not, they make for terrifying, flesh-rending attacks on the Forest King’s enemies.

forest_guard.name: Forest Guard
forest_guard.fluff: Trewi are not always known to fight in dense formations of warriors, but they understand the need for stalwart braves when the time for battle comes. As such, the Forest Guard acts as a standing military force, often serving as the retinue of local lords.

forest_prince.name: Forest Prince
forest_prince.fluff: Considered children of divine monarchs, these imperious nobles lead Sylvan tribes as well as warbands. Deadly with a blade or bow, mounted on the back of a ferocious creature or shoulder to shoulder with their fellow kinsband, they are not to be trifled with, for they show no mercy to outsiders.

forest_rangers.name: Forest Rangers
forest_rangers.fluff: Those who are specially proficient at arms are sometimes inducted into the kinsband rangers. First into combat, wielding fearsome glaives, they function as shock troops, cutting a bloody path through the forest’s enemies.

great_elk_mount.name: Great Elk
great_elk_mount.fluff: The most proud and wild lords choose the largest woodland stags as their majestic mounts. They move silently in the forest but are terrifying in battle, with sharp antlers and powerful bodies.

heath_riders.name: Heath Riders
heath_riders.fluff: With their herds reared and trained in forest heaths and meadows, elven riders are fearsome and lightning fast; their skills as harassers and hunters allow little respite to invaders who have managed to penetrate the forest.

kestrel_knights.name: Kestrel Knights
kestrel_knights.fluff: Some elves dream of flight, and it’s not uncommon for these individuals to bond with the giant kestrels of the deeper forests. If knighted, they become scouts and protectors of Sylvan borders, and when driven to fight they’re always in the vanguard of the host. More than once a rout has begun with a kestrel’s warcry.

pathfinders.name: Pathfinders
pathfinders.fluff: The hardiest sentinels may be recruited to a secretive Pathfinder band and become the epitome of silent death from afar. Even by Sylvan standards, civilization is nothing but a distant memory to these feral yet highly respected elves. They may become more akin to wolves than other Trewi, but their arrows are more swift and true than almost any archers alive.

sylvan_archers.name: Sylvan Archers
sylvan_archers.fluff: While some prefer the sword or spear, most elves’ first love is the bow. Even the youngest Trewi warrior is a farsighted hunter, and incursions can often be ended with a swift volley the moment the enemy steps into the forest. Trewi bowcraft is equally accomplished; these are powerful weapons wielded by archers of frightening skill.

sylvan_sentinels.name: Sylvan Sentinels
sylvan_sentinels.fluff: Brave monster-hunters and guerrilla fighters, the sentinels of Wyscan and other Trewi lands are the ultimate frontier survivors and masters of the furthest forests. They’re known to coat their arrows with virulent poisons to dispatch dangerous beasts and enemies alike.

thicket_beasts.name: Thicket Beasts
thicket_beasts.fluff: Forest spirits whose arboreal vessels have been lost, these beasts inhabit nearby vegetation, becoming moving masses of briar and bramble. Often preying on those who wander too close to the forest edge​, they can be docile until roused to anger, displaying great hatred for interlopers. They’re not always easy to sway to a Trewi army, but will gladly fight against any who harm their habitats.

thicket_shepherd.name: Thicket Shepherd
thicket_shepherd.leadership:
(one choice only),
		General=free,
		Battle Standard Bearer=50,
thicket_shepherd.fluff: While most thicket beasts are all but mindless, acting upon base anger and hungers, those few with intellects intact often seek to guide the instincts of their wilder siblings, acting as stewards of the darker woods. These shepherds are tragic figures, burdened by the knowledge of their loss, but with a drive to see the forests protected at all costs.

treefather.name: Treefather
treefather.fluff: Colossal and majestic, the rage of a woken lord of trees is an awesome thing to behold. More than one Trewi band owes their victory to a treefather holding the enemy at bay. Their roots can hold them fast against any foe, and will even extend to grasp attackers and pull them beneath the earth.

treefather_ancient.name: Treefather Ancient
treefather_ancient.fluff: The mightiest of the fey supernals that bonded with the forest in ages past, the ancient treefathers are as close to leaders as the forest spirits have. Walking giants taking the form of the largest, most gnarled and hardened trees, they see themselves as mentors to both spirit and elf, and are rich in ancient knowledge and mystic lore.

sylvan_unicorn_mount.name: Sylvan Unicorn
sylvan_unicorn_mount.fluff: Creatures of both the mundane and the Veiled realms, spanning every colour imaginable, the hoofprints of a unicorn who is attuned to the wildest, deepest parts of the forest will fill with rapidly growing plant life. It’s said that only the most powerful of elven mages can form a bond with these mysterious equine spirits, sacred to Sura, the Bringer of Spring.

wild_huntsmen.name: Wild Huntsmen
wild_huntsmen.fluff: Madness accompanies those who have surrendered to the path of the hunt, for they are the heralds of the Forest King himself. Savage and belligerent, festooned with scrimshaw bones and teeth, the crazed deerback charge of a band of huntsmen has been known to break even the steadiest of lines, for the world trembles whenever the Wild Hunt rides forth.

altar_of_undeath.name: Altar of Undeath
altar_of_undeath.fluff: A lodestone of necromantic power that gradually begins to reach across the Veil when activated, this foul war engine contains unholy relics intended as a perversion of the religious rituals of mortals. It allows tormented souls to seep into the material world and harm the living, under the direction of a necromancer revelling in the spectral energies they have unleashed.

banshee.name: Banshee
banshee.shootingweaponsdef:
Wail of Woe - Shooting Weapon

Wail of WoeAuto8"D6+241March and Shoot,Unmodifiable, Magical Attacks, Hits Automatically
banshee.fluff: The tormented spirits of those mourning for lost loved ones and refusing to exit the Mortal Realm, banshees can be called forth as ghosts to enact grief-stricken revenge on the living. Their piercing wail is the last thing many mortals hear before joining these spectres in death.

barrow_guard.name: Barrow Guard
barrow_guard.fluff: The retinue of kings long dead, these wights display a skill and ferocity rarely seen in the undead. Forever bound to their master, they will die a second death to safeguard their lord. Their battle gear may be rusted, but their blades retain an uncanny edge despite the long years of disuse.

barrow_king.name: Barrow King
barrow_king.fluff: In ages past, great warrior-kings were interred beneath grim tombs across the world. In a cruel twist of fate, these crowned heads are now slaves to the whims of the necromancer who raised them from their sleep. Yet their old self still resides within them, remembering old glories and long-forgotten battles, and they retain greater self-direction than most.

barrow_knights.name: Barrow Knights
barrow_knights.fluff: Only the noblest and most prestigious of the warriors of old rode and were buried with their beloved steeds. Armed and armoured with the full panoply of war, their body and soul are preserved by ancient rituals. Now a pale shadow of their former selves, they ride forth from cold barrows at the direction of a will not their own, but with a familiar drive for battle.

bat_swarms.name: Bat Swarms
bat_swarms.fluff: Nocturnal creatures like bats are easily controlled in undeath by practitioners of the necromantic arts. In times of war, they form dark clouds of wings and teeth eager to taste blood, mobbing their targets in a wild confusion of moving creatures, making it difficult to fight back.

cadaver_wagon.name: Cadaver Wagon
cadaver_wagon.fluff: This unholy chariot is drawn by zombies and manned by a hooded adept of necromancy. Magically fortified to enable the grim task of corpse collection, its very presence acts as a locus of death magic, reinforcing the necromantic bindings of nearby dead, making them even harder to put down.

colossal_zombie_dragon_mount.name: Colossal Zombie Dragon
colossal_zombie_dragon_mount.fluff: Not content with reanimating a dragon, some vampires have attempted to engorge and expand these leviathans even further using unnatural experiments. Such an achievement is usually impossible without an entire Covenant lodge working together, but the result is something truly diabolical.

court_of_the_damned.name: Court of the Damned
court_of_the_damned.fluff: An official gathering of Covenant members is proudly described as a Damned Court. Such intimate units can be fraternal comrades, rivals or even lovers, and they ride together in battle, enthroned on chariots pulled by ghostly minions. The passage of their masters can drive nearby undead to throw off some of their customary lethargy, putting a little bounce in their shamble.

dark_coach.name: Dark Coach
dark_coach.fluff: Driven to hide themselves from the face of the sun, vampires seeking to travel abroad by daylight often make use of dark coaches. Normally using glamours to pass as lordly carriages, their full deathly splendour is revealed in battle as vehicles of war. In lands ruled by vampires, the peasantry know to prostrate themselves at the passage of such carriages.

dire_wolves.name: Dire Wolves
dire_wolves.fluff: The reanimated forms of great black wolves that once prowled the dark forests of the world, these creatures are a terrifying sight to any mortal. In death, the pack continues its hunt, ferociously leaping upon unfortunate prey and dragging them to a grisly end. Vampires are often particularly fond of such canine playthings.

ghasts.name: Ghasts
ghasts.fluff: Necromancers are not limited to reanimating man-sized corpses to do their bidding. With sufficient arcane power, it’s possible to raise the hulking cadavers of trolls, ogres or large wild animals. Like ghouls, such beasts are usually driven by ravenous and predatory souls, attacking with jaws infected by the poisons of decay and proving particularly difficult to stop.

ghouls.name: Ghouls
ghouls.fluff: Reanimated corpses that hunger for the flesh of the living, these nightmarish creatures are empowered by the souls of vicious predators. This makes them faster and more ravenous than most undead, and their frenzied assaults are often enhanced by the natural graveyard toxins found in their rotting mouths – the ghoul’s weapon of choice.

great_bats.name: Great Bats
great_bats.fluff: Monstrous bats that inhabit mountain caves or the lofts of abandoned castles, these deadly blood-drinkers serve as hunters, scouts and spies for their undead overlords. They can be equally potent in battle, falling on enemy soldiers from out of moonlit skies just when their victims thought they were safe.

monstrous_revenant_mount.name: Monstrous Revenant
monstrous_revenant_mount.fluff: Souls that resist the crossing of the Veil out of an obsessive desire for revenge are known as revenants. Such individuals can be particularly potent when it comes to the animation of cadavers, and vampires often reserve their use to power the most fearsome vessels, such as great undead animals or even fleshy abominations created in necromantic laboratories.

necromancer.name: Necromancer
necromancer.fluff: Mortal men are doomed to die, but some use the avenue provided by forbidden magics to escape their fate. A slow arcane corruption stains their souls, and they will gradually come to resemble the undead they command. They can prove useful allies and servants to a vampiric master, or they can lead undead forces entirely of their own devising.

phantom_hosts.name: Phantom Hosts
phantom_hosts.fluff: Souls that are unable to pass to the afterlife remain trapped in the Mortal Realm, held by intense feelings of regret, grief and rage, thronging together in shared bitterness towards those that still live. While their former identities have faded over the years, some can still affect the material world, haunting the living and freezing the blood in their veins.

shrieking_horror.name: Shrieking Horror
shrieking_horror.shootingweaponsdef:
Chilling Howl - Shooting Weapon

Chilling HowlAuto8"HP*910March and Shoot, Magical Attacks, Hits Automatically,Psychic Attacks, Unmodifiable
* The number of shots is equal to the model’s current number of HP.
shrieking_horror.fluff: Bat-like creatures of draconic proportions, these monsters dwell in remote and uninhabited lands, but their corpses are sought by vampires as the mightiest of war mounts and the highest symbols of the Covenant. Some say they’re reanimated with the souls of banshees, others that they possess enhanced versions of bats’ natural screeching. In either case, their cry is horrifically lethal.

skeletal_steed_mount.name: Skeletal Steed
skeletal_steed_mount.fluff: Simple to raise, rotting carcasses of horse-flesh can continue to serve even when there’s little left of them but bones. No longer susceptible to pain or injury, such steeds can overcome much more challenging terrain than their living counterparts.

skeletons.name: Skeletons
skeletons.fluff: Necromantic bindings allow the skeletal remains of the long-dead to walk again as nothing but filthy bones. These frightening troops are called forth to fight on behalf of new masters. Vampires typically prefer the skeletons of ancient warriors already equipped with weapons, capable of basic military actions, with human souls to guide them.

spectral_hunters.name: Spectral Hunters
spectral_hunters.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spells from the following:
spectral_hunters.fluff: Wraiths mounted on fiery steeds, thundering across the night sky to reap their tally of souls, these ghostly riders have been equipped by their vampiric masters as a raiding party mimicking the wild, torch-bearing hunts of humans and elves. Blazing with unnatural flames, they bring terror to the hearts of all they encounter.

spectral_steed_mount.name: Spectral Steed
spectral_steed_mount.fluff: The spirits of the mightiest horses can yearn to ride forth even after death – a wish that can be granted with the application of necromancy. Having left their mortal constraints behind, these ghostly beasts can now gallop through the very air itself.

vampire_count.name: Vampire Count
vampire_count.fluff: A dark mirror of human nobility, “Count” is the best known among the highest ranks of the Covenant. Having conquered death itself, these ancient vampires seek mastery over the living and the dead. In addition to their already formidable abilities, many have amassed significant temporal power over mortal realms, hiding in plain sight to further their goals.

vampire_courtier.name: Vampire Courtier
vampire_courtier.leadership:
One choice only:,
		General and The Dead Arise=20,
		Battle Standard Bearer=50
vampire_courtier.fluff: Lower ranks (or “degrees”) within the Covenant are collectively known as Courtiers, vying among themselves to ascend in prestige and power. Make no mistake, even lesser vampires are tremendously dangerous, thanks to enhanced speed and strength, and are often capable mages as well.

vampire_knights.name: Vampire Knights
vampire_knights.fluff: These black knights hold themselves to a twisted version of the chivalric ideal, clad in thick and dreadful armours and mounted on rotting, fearsome steeds. Any who cannot match them in battle are judged and found wanting, fit only to be trampled into the dirt, while those who put up a worthy contest are deemed suitable for consumption or even initiation.

vampire_spawn.name: Vampire Spawn
vampire_spawn.fluff: Certain vampires that have mastered the art of shapeshifting can become attached to their bestial forms, unwilling – and eventually unable – to return to a human appearance. These creatures of the night have often transformed into hulking, bat-like humanoids that fall upon their prey in a fury of wings, talons and fangs.

varkolak.name: Varkolak
varkolak.fluff: A vampire that repeatedly indulges its Thirst, giving into constant gorging, will gradually degenerate into a ravenous, ever-hungry being whose mind is clouded by a red mist. Powerful, yet lacking their former intelligence and cunning, these vampires have become little more than beasts whose will can be shackled to that of stronger Night Lords.

winged_reapers.name: Winged Reapers
winged_reapers.fluff: Constructs of bone and malice brought to life by necromantic rituals, these dread reapers glide across the battlefield on desiccated wings, using terrible scythes or sickles to mow their living crop. They are the shadows over the face of the moon, known to many cultures as angels of death.

wraiths.name: Wraiths
wraiths.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spells from the following:
wraiths.fluff: The black souls of corrupt judges, cruel executioners and necromancers refusing to depart from this world, wraiths are malign spirits that seek to continue dispensing fell justice on those they deem unworthy of the life they themselves have lost.

zombie_dragon_mount.name: Zombie Dragon
zombie_dragon_mount.fluff: The pinnacle of necromantic ambition is the resurrection of a dragon. Even finding the body of such a mighty creature is incredibly unlikely, for they rarely die, and usually far from prying eyes. They must then be bound with sufficiently formidable souls: no easy task. But the reward for success is the complete control of the world’s greatest predator.

zombies.name: Zombies
zombies.fluff: Groaning, shambling hordes of the recently slain, these mindless cadavers can overwhelm the living through sheer weight of numbers. Driven by the souls of simple creatures, their instincts are basic and animalistic, seeking only to grasp and dismember whatever they encounter.

amuut_mount.name: Amuut
amuut_mount.fluff: Since ascending to undeath, some nobles have preferred to eschew the chariot in favour of stone mounts: giant living statues bearing Naptesh’s greatest warriors down upon their enemies, often taking the shape of vicious predators.

ark_of_ages_mount.name: Ark of Ages
ark_of_ages_mount.fluff: The most important relics and religious artefacts of old Naptesh are preserved in magical chests. They are sometimes carried to battle on great constructs by the kingdom’s priests, who use these items’ mystic potency to strike the foe from afar.

battle_sphinx.name: Battle Sphinx
battle_sphinx.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Terracotta Army=free
battle_sphinx.fluff: The awe-inspiring sphinx of legend has long represented the power of the pharaohs, and now it carries Napteshi forces to battle. Crafted with the finest stone and driven by both spells and souls, this towering statue both ignores and inflicts damage with the sheer weight of its limbs and a deathly aura poisonous to living beings.

casket_of_phatep.name: Casket of Phatep
casket_of_phatep.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Barrow Legion=5, Terracotta Army=10
casket_of_phatep.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spells from the following:
casket_of_phatep.fluff: Betrayed by the Great Jackal Setesh, the last High King’s dismembered body was interred in arcane devices that preserved his godly powers. These rare, heavily guarded and powerful artefacts, and others modelled on their design, are said to drain enemy mages, and unleash torrents of divine, face-melting magic that assail their victims’ very souls.

charnel_catapult.name: Charnel Catapult
charnel_catapult.shootingweaponsdef:
Charnel Catapult - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Charnel Catapult448"173Artillery, Area Attack(2×2), Direct Hit(Multiple Wounds(2))
.
If this weapon causes any HP loss, the target must immediately take a Panic Test.
charnel_catapult.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Barrow Legion=5, Terracotta Army=10
charnel_catapult.fluff: With their massive frames and flexible arms, the catapults of old were devastating weapons that could turn the tides of ancient battles. Now, in addition to huge rocks, these magically-preserved machines can fling enchanted volleys of burning flesh and bones at the enemy, combining destruction and terror.

colossus.name: Colossus
colossus.shootingweaponsdef:
Giant Aspis Bow - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Giant Aspis Bow448"1310Area Attack(1×5), Direct Hit(Str 6, Multiple Wounds(D3)),Aspis Arrows
colossus.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Terracotta Army=free, Barrow Legion=free
colossus.fluff: Originally constructed (and sometimes still used) as labourers, the Colossi of Naptesh now primarily stand guard over what they helped to build. They are the pharaohs’ hands, a shield against the storms of war. Eerily still for centuries, these titans can shake the earth once roused, and have been armed with devastating magical weaponry.

death_cult_hierarch.name: Death Cult Hierarch
death_cult_hierarch.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Barrow Legion=5, Terracotta Army=10
death_cult_hierarch.fluff: Masters of ancient magic, these sorcerers were – and are – priests of Hanu, Napteshi God of Embalming. It was their ability to raise the fallen that saved Naptesh in the civil war. Even today, they alone allow the kingdom’s armies to march to battle. To stand before a hierarch of the Death Cult is to witness the true depths of Naptesh’s Curse.

dread_sphinx.name: Dread Sphinx

offenserules.name: Multiple Wounds
params: towards Height 4--5 with 5 or more starting HP

dread_sphinx.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Terracotta Army=free
dread_sphinx.fluff: Even taller and more terrifying than other sphinxes, the Dread Sphinx is typically endowed with massive wings. Unridden, animated by the mightiest souls, it thinks and moves for itself, albeit with a particularly dire and unforgiving intelligence, carrying enormous weapons crafted for hunting down and slaying monsters that threaten the kingdom.

great_vultures.name: Great Vultures
great_vultures.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Barrow Legion=free,
great_vultures.fluff: Alive, the giant carrion birds of the Great Desert can soar the skies for days; after reanimation, they need never come down at all, keeping an ever-watchful eye on the dunes. Yet their necromantic masters can also bid the cadavers of these large vultures strike at hapless ground dwellers in terrifying aerial assaults.

necropolis_guard.name: Necropolis Guard
necropolis_guard.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Barrow Legion=1/model, Terracotta Army=5/model,
necropolis_guard.fluff: Chosen from the kingdom’s most proven warriors, these guardians are responsible for the ultimate defence of Naptesh’s holy tombs and buried cities. Versatile combatants capable of multiple forms of armed combat, they escort their rulers to war, ready to repel any threat to their eternal lords.

nomarch.name: Nomarch
nomarch.leadership:
,
			General=20,
			Battle Standard Bearer*=70,
			Solitary=20,
			Captain and Attached=free,
			=,
		* Deathless Noble and Tomb Harbinger only=,
nomarch.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Barrow Legion=15, Terracotta Army=20
nomarch.fluff: Royal courtiers were also revered by their people as lords, warriors and trusted advisors to the monarch. Bannermen serving as incarnate symbols of the enemy's certain demise; revered craftspeople ensuring the kingdom's monuments last the ages; or mighty mummified nobles – whatever their role, they remain merciless defenders of their lands, and their actions on the battlefield represent the will of the Pharaoh.

pharaoh.name: Pharaoh
pharaoh.armyorganisationoptions: One choice only:, Commander of the Terracotta Army=25, Lord of the Barrow Legion=15,
pharaoh.fluff: The rulers of the desert sands are revered as demigods by their subjects. In life, their power was absolute, commanding legions of loyal followers. In unlife, it has only grown, becoming a remorseless, everlasting authority over the desert itself. Divine, skeletal avatars clad in ancient finery, they have faced countless foes and yet still they rule supreme.

sand_scorpion.name: Sand Scorpion
sand_scorpion.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Barrow Legion and loses Ambush=free, Terracotta Army and loses Ambush=free
sand_scorpion.fluff: This fearsome sentinel of the necropolis represents the deadliness of the desert itself. A carved imitation of Naptesh’s giant scorpions, it emerges from the dunes to strike its prey with enormous, bone-crushing claws and a lethal stinger, containing venom that can kill in minutes.

sand_stalkers.name: Sand Stalkers
sand_stalkers.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Barrow Legion and loses Ambush=free, Terracotta Army and loses Ambush=free
sand_stalkers.shootingweaponsdef:
Petrifying Gaze - Shooting Weapon

Petrifying GazeAuto12"2*10Stand and Shoot, Hits Automatically, Unmodifiable,
* To-wound rolls are set to 5+.
sand_stalkers.fluff: These statues were long ago fitted with gemstone eyes ensorcelled to provide a connection to the Thewat afterlife. Following the Curse that cut Naptesh off from that realm, these portals now show nothing but void, turning all before them to lifeless rock. Animated by the dynasty, they stalk the dead kingdom, usually with serpentine forms that can burrow under the sands.

scarab_swarms.name: Scarab Swarms
scarab_swarms.armyorganisationoptions:
Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Barrow Legion and Ghastly Swarm*=30/model, =, *Cannot be taken with Ambush.
4, and Rare.=,
scarab_swarms.fluff: A lone, docile scarab is a jewel among beetles, and a holy symbol in Naptesh. But in an undead, hungry swarm, these flesh-eating insects can attack from any hidden crevice, overwhelming and devouring victims in minutes thanks to their razor sharp mandibles and acidic secretions.

shabti_archers.name: Shabti Archers
shabti_archers.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Barrow Legion=free, Terracotta Army=free
shabti_archers.fluff: Within these shabti rest the souls of the greatest archers of the nobility. Wielding blessed bows of stupendous proportions, their spear-sized arrows can pierce even the thickest of armour at great distance.

shabtis.name: Shabtis
shabtis.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Barrow Legion=free, Terracotta Army=free
shabtis.fluff: Grave sculptures originally intended to perform the deceased’s labour in the afterlife, these tall statues of animal-headed figures can be brought to life with the spirits of legendary heroes, granting them immense strength. Their imposing presence and fearsome fighting abilities make them ideal guardians of sacred sites and the very dead they were always meant to serve.

sha_guardian_mount.name: Sha Guardian
sha_guardian_mount.fluff: Gigantic statues of mythological creatures were built to stand watch over sacred pyramids in ancient Naptesh. While they can no longer fulfill their purpose of defending their lords in the afterlife, they can now do so in the Mortal Realm, when they are awoken by necromancy so powerful that even the most titanic blows cannot fully undo the magical bindings.

skeletal_horse_mount.name: Skeletal Horse
skeletal_horse_mount.fluff: It’s not just the soldiers of Naptesh whose bones have been preserved through the eons. Their mounts too have been kept, so they might be restored to undeath whenever the time for battle comes. Once the steed’s soul is reattached to its corpse, it may ride on for millenia.

skeleton_archers.name: Skeleton Archers
skeleton_archers.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Barrow Legion=1/model, Terracotta Army=1/model
skeleton_archers.fluff: The enchanted bows of Naptesh are said to recreate the lethal bite of the desert serpents, which hold great symbolic value. Enabling undead archers to hit their targets with eerie precision, these weapons embody the futility of attempting to outrun death. None escape the wrath of the Desert.

skeleton_cavalry.name: Skeleton Cavalry
skeleton_cavalry.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Barrow Legion=2/model, Terracotta Army=2/model
skeleton_cavalry.fluff: These mounted regiments were once tribes of nomadic horse masters, lightly armoured, yet fast and deadly, until they suffered the Curse side by side with their mounts. Despite their fragile appearance, their ability to swiftly reach around enemy flanks and strike in quick, decisive blows makes them a fearsome addition to Undying forces.

skeleton_chariot_mount.name: Skeleton Chariot
skeleton_chariot_mount.fluff: The lords of Naptesh are conveyed to battle on gold-encrusted vehicles, scattering their enemies before them. These legendary chariots have been driven by the same devoted skeletal crews for millennia, their scythed wheels remaining preternaturally sharp.

skeleton_chariots.name: Skeleton Chariots
skeleton_chariots.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Barrow Legion=10/model, Terracotta Army=15/model
skeleton_chariots.fluff: Meticulously crafted, Napteshi chariots have for centuries crushed the kingdom’s enemies beneath their wheels. Able to operate either as manoeuvrable skirmishers or in vast, unstoppable battalions, the crew atop the chariot’s platform were not only drivers but honoured warriors, and even in death they often form the close retinue of kings and princes.

skeleton_scouts.name: Skeleton Scouts
skeleton_scouts.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Barrow Legion=1/model, =
skeleton_scouts.fluff: In ancient Naptesh, the most talented archers became scouts on horseback. Their skill retained throughout the centuries, their skeletal steeds still run with a twisted grace, and their bows continue to deliver only death.

skeleton_warriors.name: Skeleton Warriors
skeleton_warriors.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Barrow Legion=1/model, Terracotta Army=2/model
skeleton_warriors.fluff: Bound by ancient magic, the spirits of the loyal soldiers of the Undying Dynasties usually inhabit their own remains, so their dusty bones may know bloodshed once again. No vampire’s rotted puppets driven by animal hunger, these are proud warriors, cold and relentless, skeletons and weaponry kept in service ​by incomparable secrets of preservation.

tomb_cataphracts.name: Tomb Cataphracts
tomb_cataphracts.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Terracotta Army and loses Ambush=free
tomb_cataphracts.fluff: Charioteers who prove their worth may be permitted to ride upon a living statue of a holy animal, such as a snake, crocodile, or beetle. These remarkable constructs are coated in toxins and are able to bury themselves beneath the sand to surprise their enemies. Armed with long blades, this unique cavalry offers a deadly combination of brute force and tactical manoeuvring.

tomb_reapers.name: Tomb Reapers
tomb_reapers.armyorganisationoptions: Note that these options require all models in an army to be upgraded with the same option, and a Pharaoh must be the army General: =, Barrow Legion=free,
tomb_reapers.fluff: Despite Naptesh’s perilous reputation, there are always those foolish enough to attempt to rob its sacred tombs. Some desecrators even escape unscathed – until they are visited by the Desert’s avengers. From the skies they descend, like angels of death: flying stone creatures armed with long blades, exacting retribution with swiftness and efficiency.

arena_beast.name: Arena Beast
arena_beast.fluff: The most popular attractions at the bloodthirsty circuses of the Vermin are the monsters brought to fight hapless gladiators or devour convicts. Many such hulks are the mutated products of nightmarish Fetthis breeding programs; others are yet stranger beasts captured in the Deeps. When need arises, these enormous terrors can be set loose in battle, to appalling effect.

blackfur_veterans.name: Blackfur Veterans
blackfur_veterans.fluff: Better trained and granted stronger armour, rats who show an aptitude for fighting form their own detachments that drill with more advanced formations. Often they have darker fur, a sign of robust health and more fearful reputation; those with reddish fur are even better suited to war and are often hired to protect politicians.

bloodfur_legate.name: Bloodfur Legate
bloodfur_legate.leadership:
One choice only:,
			General=free,
			Battle Standard Bearer=50,
bloodfur_legate.fluff: Legionary commanders, often known for reddish fur that hides their wounds, are hardened veterans and career soldiers, though many also aspire to political power. Favoured legates are appointed to carry the rare and highly prized ancient eagles inherited from the Vermin’s human predecessors.

doomspark_device.name: Doomspark Device
doomspark_device.shootingweaponsdef:
Darkstone Generator - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Darkstone GeneratorAuto12"D3+1D6+13March and Shoot, Lightning Attacks, Maniacal Enthusiasm(To-wound roll),Unmodifiable, Automatic Hits
doomspark_device.fluff: The most powerful darkstone apparatus yet invented, this ungodly machine is driven by the magically-contained electrical charges stored within the mineral. These are often generated by Vermin on circular treadmills before and sometimes during a battle, and can be discharged with irresistible if unpredictable force against enemy targets.

dreadmill_chariots.name: Dreadmill Chariots
dreadmill_chariots.fluff: Smaller than Doomspark machines, these vehicles cover great distances on giant wheels powered by volatile darkstone engines. After forward movement, the charged chassis can electrocute those it touches. Inspired by the great races in the hippodromes of the ancients, these chariots are equally violent during both operation and unscheduled disassembly.

duskblade_assassin.name: Duskblade Assassin
duskblade_assassin.fluff: Vermin politics is monitored by a shadowy, much-feared cabal of assassins informally known as the Dusk Senate. Its members seek to prevent the rise of a single king or tyrant through judicious use of their skills, though their motives are inscrutable and rarely pure. When their objectives require them to go to battle, they’re a secret and deadly weapon.

experimental_weapon_teams.name: Experimental Weapon Teams
experimental_weapon_teams.fluff: The most unusual and destructive Vermin weapons are developed by the maniacal inventors of House Rakachit and the unhinged scientists of House Skorchit. Dozens of prototypes are created, but only the most stable are widely deployed in Vermin armies. Even these are prone to frequent and remarkable malfunctions, but the decimating effect of their application is undeniable.

giant_rats.name: Giant Rats
giant_rats.fluff: Not content with regular rats, the Vermin have succeeded in making their familial pets even more alarming by breeding them to large sizes: enormous scurrying creatures that can be sent against enemy forces in a mindless frenzy. Caring little for gentle treatment, Vermin sometimes coat the largest of these animals in pitch and set them alight as they run into battle.

gladiator_brutes.name: Gladiator Brutes
gladiator_brutes.fluff: Larger brutes are particularly popular at gladiatorial games. Though their weapons are copied from mosaics depicting ancient arena fighters, they are rarely used in the classical combinations, but rather taken altogether with typical Vermin enthusiasm. This makes for spectacular carnage - whether in the Colosseum or on the battlefield.

house_prefect.name: House Prefect
house_prefect.fluff: The Great Houses of Avras frequently send their officials to accompany legions, primarily to gain intelligence and influence. These functionaries are often highly skilled in a singular field, and come armed with their House’s best weapons. They’re sometimes able to support a Vermin army with their expertise in quite dramatic fashion.

ignifier_grenadiers.name: Ignifier Grenadiers
ignifier_grenadiers.shootingweaponsdef:
Deepfire Grenades - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Deepfire Grenades58"262Accurate, Flaming Attacks, Quick to Fire, Deepfire Grenades


Deepfire Grenades
When shooting at an enemy unit Engaged in Combat (using the Callous rule), hits are distributed onto a randomly chosen friendly unit Engaged with the original target on a roll of 5+ instead of 4+.
ignifier_grenadiers.fluff: Many Vermin show a disturbing love for explosives. Inevitably, this tendency has revealed itself within the legions in the form of regiments trained in the use of throwing bombs, exploiting a kind of alchemical fire also used in mining. These devices only rarely explode in the hands of their own users.

legionary_drill_team.name: Legionary Drill Team
legionary_drill_team.fluff: Vermin engineers have developed large industrial drills to assist in tunnel digging and other underground operations. These have been repurposed by many commanders for battlefield applications: such devices can not only serve as grisly weapons, but can also open up fresh tunnels at short notice, allowing cohorts to escape or redeploy.

plague_cultists.name: Plague Cultists
plague_cultists.fluff: Followers of Errahman have recently made decisive contributions to Avrasi armies. They carry fast-spreading contagions that can prove quite deadly to enemies who get close enough to fight; even their weapons are coated in infected blood. Fuelled by holy righteousness, they are eager to fight as long as they feel they have their god’s favour.

praetorian_brute_mount.name: Praetorian Brute
praetorian_brute_mount.fluff: High-ranking Vermin officials can be assigned a brute bodyguard by Avras’ elite praetorian guard. Normally reserved for watching the doors to the Senate Hall or the treasury vaults, these valuable, semi-intelligent protectors are fiercely loyal to their master.
