In battle, they accompany their charge or allow them to ride into the fray upon their back.

rat_swarm.name: Rat Swarm
rat_swarm.fluff: While the Vermin species is intelligent, bipedal, and almost human-sized, it still shares a kinship with its evolutionary originators, the common four-legged rats found all across the world. Though comparatively tiny, these ordinary rodents are frightening to most, and in horrific roiling swarms of teeth and tails, trained to obey Vermin signals, they can overwhelm any opponent.

ruinous_dictator.name: Ruinous Dictator
ruinous_dictator.additionalframe: |¨title¨: ¨I am the Senate¨, ¨def¨: ¨ When calculating Combat Score for Combats containing one or more friendly unit within 12" of a Ruinous Dictator, your side adds +1 to their Combat Score. ¨§, |¨title¨: ¨Lord of the Legions¨, ¨def¨: ¨ The model’s Standard Melee Attacks gains Multiple Wounds(D3).¨§, |¨title¨: ¨Pontifex Maximus¨, ¨def¨: ¨ The model may take (and pay the price for) one item from Artefacts or Potions and Scrolls, worth up to 50 pts, that is normally available to Vermin Swarm Characters. ¨§,
ruinous_dictator.fluff: Through arcane rituals, an ambitious Vermin can bond itself with a Caelysian supernal, becoming a monster of terrible physical and magical power. Such a union is a highly hazardous undertaking, and one which cannot be undone. The beast is obsessed with power, appointing itself dictator (a temporary rank in ancient times) and ruling the Swarm as a despised tyrant.

sacred_platform_mount.name: Sacred Platform
sacred_platform_mount.fluff: Not to be outdone by their military counterparts, many high priests have constructed their own formidable platforms, thronged by zealous followers both in the streets of Avras and on the battlefield. Bells consecrated to the old gods call the faithful to the fight, while the Plague Cult often constructs intimidating podiums to promote conversion of the masses.

senatorial_litter_mount.name: Senatorial Litter
senatorial_litter_mount.fluff: Senators frequently hire elite guards to bear them aloft into battle, ensuring they can be seen and remembered by the common soldiers. Those brave enough to approach the fighting itself stand to win acclaim for their boldness, gaining support from the rank and file.

shadowfur_stalkers.name: Shadowfur Stalkers

globalrules.name: Ambush
params: Terrain Feature with a friendly Tunnel Marker

shadowfur_stalkers.fluff: The wealth of House Sicarra derives from its illicit trading and thievery, exploiting black markets across much of the world. Its operatives learn to move unnoticed, becoming expert navigators of complex tunnel systems and unafraid of back-alley violence. The House loans these agents to the legions for a "fair" price, to be used in guerrilla manoeuvres and short range assaults.

stygian_earthbreaker.name: Stygian Earthbreaker

globalrules.name: Ambush
params: Terrain Feature with a friendly Tunnel Marker

stygian_earthbreaker.fluff: Spectacularly enlarged versions of legionary drills, these crowning triumphs of House Stygia resemble armoured vehicles with a rotating, bladed front section capable of ploughing through the depths of the earth and enemy bodies alike. Their gnawing metal forms can rise up from the ground and sink again with alarming ease, making them a tremendous challenge to deal with.

swarm_priest.name: Swarm Priest
swarm_priest.pathsnote: If the model has Cult of Errahman
swarm_priest.pathsnoteB: If the model has Caelysian Pantheon
swarm_priest.fluff: The Vermin have long relied upon religion to manage and direct the mob. Vermin priests have not only amassed considerable political sway, but have also succeeded in monopolising magical training. Regardless of the gods they follow, these figures are often willing to lend their wisdom and spellcraft in support of the legions to prove their commitment to Avras and attract new worshippers.

thunder_brutes.name: Thunder Brutes
thunder_brutes.fluff: The strongest and most adaptable to training among Fetthis' brutes are often taught to carry and operate the exotic ranged weapons supplied by the other Houses. While these deadly artillerists are able to fire such machines to maximum effect, their instructors rarely bother to mention the potential for malfunction...

triumphal_platform_mount.name: Triumphal Platform
triumphal_platform_mount.fluff: Commanders who achieve great success on military campaigns are, by long tradition, welcomed back to Avras with a triumph: a parade in their honour. The moving platforms from these events – often featuring ancient masonry – have been used in battle as well. Not only do they glorify the rider, but their momentum and savage pulling beasts make them potent chariots of war.

vermin_artillery.name: Vermin Artillery
vermin_artillery.shootingweaponsdef:
Skorchit Ordnance - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Skorchit Ordnance548"141Artillery, Flaming Attacks, Area Attack(3×3)


Rakachit Mauss Rifle - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Rakachit Mauss Rifle548"152Artillery, Lightning Attacks, Area Attack(1×3), Direct Hit(Str 10, AP 4, Multiple Wounds(D3+1))
vermin_artillery.fluff: Experimental long-ranged war machines have proven highly effective in supporting the legions. The most popular among Vermin commanders are those that hurl globes of burning chemicals, and the newly developed, darkstone-powered long guns that deliver devastating bolts across the field.

vermin_brutes.name: Vermin Brutes
vermin_brutes.fluff: House Fetthis specialises in husbandry of all kinds, but its most famous creations are those meant for battle or protection. Sacrificing intelligence for size and strength, these so-called brutes are just savvy enough to act as enforcers or legionary shock troops.

vermin_legionaries.name: Vermin Legionaries
vermin_legionaries.fluff: The backbone of Vermin armies is composed of simple “legionary” soldiers, normally plebeian conscripts enticed by the prospect of regular food and pay. Given basic training and weapons, they’re so numerous and easily recruited that few commanders give much thought to high casualty rates.

vermin_senator.name: Vermin Senator
vermin_senator.fluff: While the Senate’s power has fluctuated over the centuries, the rank has always been prestigious and coveted by the entire political class. Seeking ever more wealth and influence, many senators sponsor legions and attend battles in person to win both popular support and military control. Rarely skilled fighters, they can nevertheless sway a battle with their authority and stirring orations.

vermin_slaves.name: Vermin Slaves
vermin_slaves.fluff: Slavery is much more prevalent among Vermin than it was for human Avras; uncountable throngs of dispossessed rats are available for drafting into any army, promised freedom if they survive. An ocean of flesh, their lives freely traded for any small advantage, they’re completely untrained and undisciplined, but they can overwhelm with numbers or support manual labour underground.

vermin_slingers.name: Vermin Slingers
vermin_slingers.shootingweaponsdef:
Sling - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Sling418"140Quick to Fire, Attacks made at Long Range have their Str set to 3
vermin_slingers.fluff: The term for the javelin-welding skirmishers of the ancients has been somewhat misappropriated by the Vermin. These detachments are equipped with knives and simple ranged weapons, used to harry enemies and draw their formations out of position.

anvil_of_power.name: Anvil of Power
anvil_of_power.fluff: The mightiest runes must be “earthed” in a greater weight of metal. Anvil-shaped slabs can be used to embed several; such a concentration of magical syphons can draw a substantial quantity of magic, leaving the area nearby almost entirely magic-free. Only guild master-smiths are allowed access to these potent artefacts, as it takes centuries to master the rune-lore.

clan_marksmen.name: Clan Marksmen
clan_marksmen.fluff: It’s equally common for dwarves to uphold their Clan Oath with ranged weapons as it is with blades or hammers. Many such dwarves are also oathbound to a Guild of Engineers, and like all Hold fighters, they wield arms which are uniquely fitted for their own physical specifications, resulting in weapons with deadly accuracy.

clan_warriors.name: Clan Warriors
clan_warriors.endtext: *This limitation is shared across Clan Warriors and Greybeards.
clan_warriors.fluff: A dwarf’s first oath is always to their family, and their second is to their clan. Every dwarf of oath-age is expected to fight for the Hold in times of war. The Clan Oath states that a dwarf must provide their own weapons and equipment, and will serve until an oath of greater importance honour-binds them to a higher duty.

deep_watch.name: Deep Watch
deep_watch.fluff: Below the Holds lie the Deeps: a region of lightless caverns home to strange and terrifying dangers. Between these threats and a Hold’s underground farms, mines and water sources, this subterranean cadre of dwarves stands watch. Their bravery earns them the very best armour and status in the Hold, and the duty to protect any dignitary’s journey through the Deeps.

dragon_seeker.name: Dragon Seeker
dragon_seeker.fluff: Seekers who have survived dozens of trials by combat may become fanatical. Their faith in the Old Gods becomes so powerful that some even believe they are a reincarnation of the Hold’s ancestors. These dwarves are particularly fervent in their lust for vengeance, hunting the Hold’s most grievous wrongdoers, even to the point of seeking out and dispatching dragons if necessary.

engineer.name: Engineer
engineer.optionalshootingweaponsdef:
Wyrm-Slayer Rocket - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Wyrm-Slayer Rocket324"163Multiple Wounds(D3), Flaming Attacks
engineer.fluff: Engineers boast guildhalls in almost every Hold and are famed for creating great structures, machines, and stunning feats of weaponcraft. Dwarven warmachines and firearms are of unrivalled reliability, and when these masterpieces are operated by their maker in battle, they are even more deadly.

field_artillery.name: Field Artillery
field_artillery.endtext: Dwarf Ballista=free, Dwarf Catapult=110, Dwarf Cannon=145, Organ Gun=150, Flame Cannon=70,
field_artillery.fluff: An artillery piece is a Guild-Engineer’s life’s work. Where the dwarves of the East mass-produce their weaponry, Hold dwarves focus on individual quality and precision. They dedicate years to perfecting each unique masterpiece, focussing on reliability and longevity. Further enhanced by cunning runesmiths, Hold-made artillery is rightly renowned for being among the finest – and most devastating – in the world.

forge_wardens.name: Forge Wardens
forge_wardens.shootingweaponsdef:
Forge Gun - Shooting Weapon

NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Forge Gun318"140March and Shoot, Flaming Attacks, Stand and Shoot,Always hits on 3+
forge_wardens.fluff: A ceremonial title for members of an elite force of dwarves who have proven themselves highly reliable both in battle and in complex craftwork, these guards are equipped with rare, rune-enhanced weaponry capable of raining the very flames of the forge on horrified foes.

greybeards.name: Greybeards
greybeards.endtext: *This limitation is shared across Clan Warriors and Greybeards.
greybeards.fluff: Hold dwarves rotate into military service for two years out of every ten, throughout their lives. So while their beards may turn grey, their potency in combat only grows with age. So-called greybeards form brotherhoods-in-arms over many campaigns, and prefer to fight and drink with dwarves of their own station rather than the newly bearded.

grudge_buster.name: Grudge Buster
grudge_buster.fluff: Hold dwarves are capable of creating mechanised vehicles with a combination of engineering and runecraft. Military models are known as grudge busters; each machine is unique and based on the individual specialities of a master engineer, with many brutal applications in battle. Grudge busters can be seen in the skies above the Holds or tunnelling beneath them.

hold_guardians.name: Hold Guardians
hold_guardians.fluff: Hold guardians are constructed from stone and metals, often to resemble dwarven ancestor figures. Typically positioned as a defensive measure, they’re engraved with powerful runes that can imbue motion and even a rudimentary intelligence when needed, resulting in violent countermeasures against any enemies that threaten the Hold.

king.name: King
king.fluff: Selected at a kingsmoot by the Hold’s elders on the basis of honour, a dwarven monarch serves for life. Their power is held by oath: the King’s Oath takes precedence over all others, and their authority lasts only so long as they uphold it. This makes honour and integrity essential to a successful reign. Kings are often proud, leading from the front with the Hold’s finest regalia and weaponry.

kings_guard.name: King's Guard
kings_guard.fluff: The King’s Guard is unique; its only oath is to the King. These are professional fighters who, unlike other dwarves, are not required to contribute to the Hold economically. Their sole purpose is to defend the monarch’s person and carry out their policies, both in times of war and peace. Their fighting skill and equipment are befitting of such an esteemed position.

miners.name: Miners
miners.fluff: Considered a dashing career for Hold dwarves, miners are essential for a Hold to flourish. As well as prospecting for valuable resources, they’re cartographers and explorers of the Deeps. They aid in the protection of the Hold’s tunnels, and provide vital countermining support against opponents in battle, often able to emerge behind enemy lines to great advantage.

rangers.name: Rangers
rangers.fluff: Most Holds keep lands above ground: farmlands, transport routes, and key strategic landmarks. Rangers are tasked with defending these holdings, as well as scouting both nearby and farther afield. Maintaining skills lost to most dwarves, they’re rugged survivalists and expert hunters, able to support their Hold in battle by harassing the enemy lines from advanced positions.

runic_smith.name: Runic Smith
runic_smith.fluff: Few within the Smithing Guilds possess the knowledge of how to accurately forge and strike runes of power. Guild master-smiths have access to potent runic artefacts and understand the secrets of unleashing their power on the battlefield. Those who fight alongside such skillful craftsdwarves generally find they have the sharpest weapons in the Hold.

seekers.name: Seekers
seekers.fluff: An uncompromising religious calling, Seekers dedicate themselves to pursuing those who break an oath, violate the terms of a moot, or wrong the Hold. They self-righteously enact this justice, violently, in the old way. Savage in combat, many Seekers choose to fight completely naked, leaving the outcome in the hands of ancient gods that they alone still worship.

shield_bearers_mount.name: Shield Bearers
shield_bearers_mount.fluff: The only thing more dangerous than an armed dwarf is an armed dwarf who can fight you from above. Many Hold warriors compete for the honour of carrying their leaders upon their shields, forming a particularly fearsome fighting platform.

steam_copters.name: Steam Copters
steam_copters.fluff: As time goes by, airships are becoming more essential for trade and communication between Holds separated by continents. Most dwarves loathe the open sky, yet certain pilots seem to thrive on the insanity of the adventure. The Aeronautics Guild of Kegiz Gavem first pioneered the flying machines; multiple designs exist, yet the steam copter is best-suited for war.

thane.name: Thane
thane.leadership:
,
        General=20,
        Battle Standard Bearer=70,
        Captain and Attached=free,
        Solitary=20,
        Ancient Grudge(1) (General only)=40,
thane.fluff: Each Hold is composed of several clans, themselves composed of large families. Clans are led by Thanes, a rank bound by oath to Hold and King. Clan-thanes are commonly given the honour of carrying the Holdstone; after the king, they are deemed to be the most resolute and honourable dwarves in the Hold.

vengeance_seeker.name: Vengeance Seeker
vengeance_seeker.fluff: As well as rectifying broken oaths within the Hold, some Seekers fervently balance external transgressions. They track down criminals, brigands or any man or creature deemed to have wronged their Hold. With their unorthodox and fanatical weaponry, there is only death at the hands of such Seekers; being marked is a terrifying prospect, for only one party will walk away.

war_throne_mount.name: War Throne
war_throne_mount.fluff: Hold dwarves draw comfort from all things solid and unchanging, particularly earthen minerals. Their kings are often carried to battle on stone constructs designed for combat; proximity to the ancient rock gives the rider confidence and authority. It also has the advantage of raising the monarch to a height at which their great deeds can be witnessed across the field.

barbarian_chief.name: Barbarian Chief
barbarian_chief.fluff: First among the tribes who often ally with Warriors, chief is not a position attained easily. Only by demonstrating the ability to inspire and drive their people to great deeds can such leaders win the respect of the tribe.

barbarian_horsemen.name: Barbarian Horsemen
barbarian_horsemen.fluff: Raising and riding the powerful steeds favoured by mounted Warriors, tribal elites can storm battlefields and execute merciless raids. Many a foe, dismissing them as a lesser opponent, has been trodden beneath steel-shod hooves.

barbarians.name: Barbarians
barbarians.fluff: The world is full of peoples and cultures living beyond the borders of so-called civilised lands, rejecting such values in favour of freedom and strength. Many of these hardy, battle-tested tribes either choose to follow the Dark Gods directly, or find natural allies in Warrior bands.

battleshrine.name: Battleshrine
battleshrine.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spells from the following:
battleshrine.fluff: For most peoples, a shrine is a place of calm contemplation: a stable location for prayer and devotion. Nothing so mundane should be expected among Warriors. Born aloft by deformed creatures, these profane platforms are temples to sacrifice, sorcery and sin, adorned with decorations and glyphs to pain the eye and torture the soul.

battleshrine_mount.name: Battleshrine
battleshrine_mount.forceoffensenameprint: Please display the name mighty LaTeX

black_steed_mount.name: Black Steed
black_steed_mount.fluff: Black in purpose – and often in colouration as well – these beasts are normally powerful horses bred by nomadic tribes loyal to the Dark Gods, but in some instances other creatures can be used as equally effective mounts.

chimera.name: Chimera
chimera.fluff: The Wasteland is home to many creatures which do not conform to the natural order. The chimera is perhaps the most ubiquitous of these – a combination of bodily features seemingly drawn from all manner of beings, monstrous in size and appearance, and more vicious than the sum of its parts.

chosen_model.name: Chosen
chosen_model.tags:
Path of the Favoured,
		Metal Armour,
chosen_model.fluff: There are few more deadly in battle than those who have earned the special favour of a Dark God. They may remain far from the peak of their Ascension, but to reach this station they have already endured hardships and bested foes beyond counting. In battle they embody the aspects of their divine masters, and turn them to powerful advantage.

chosen_chariot.name: Chosen Chariot
chosen_chariot.tags:
Path of the Favoured,
		Metal Armour,
chosen_chariot.fluff: A partnership between Chosen to crew a construct of war is not to be taken lightly. Even afoot, two of their number would be a force to be reckoned with. Add an armoured platform, bedecked in sigils and trophies befitting their patron, with an enraged karkadan in the lead, and the ground will tremble at their approach.

chosen_knights.name: Chosen Knights
chosen_knights.tags:
Path of the Favoured,
		Metal Armour,
chosen_knights.fluff: No ordinary steed would be fit for those who have risen up the ranks of Hell. Karkadans represent the most common choice: powerful and loyal, hard to break and harder to kill. They are a fearsome sight, but no one can doubt that the rider is the more dangerous opponent.

chosen_lord.name: Chosen Lord
chosen_lord.tags:
Path of the Favoured,
		Metal Armour
chosen_lord.endtext: Gifts of the Dark Gods. Gifts of the Dark Gods follow the general rules of Magic Items including being Legendary. ../giftsofthedarkgodsfolder/daemonicwings.tex ../giftsofthedarkgodsfolder/entropicaura.tex ../giftsofthedarkgodsfolder/luckofthedarkgods.tex ../giftsofthedarkgodsfolder/idolofspite.tex ../giftsofthedarkgodsfolder/darkprelate.tex
chosen_lord.fluff: Nearing the summit of the Path of the Favoured, these mighty champions are the disciples of their god and incarnations of sin and death. Melding a superlative skill in arms with the many gifts of their benefactor, they are notorious symbols of destruction, seeking to earn the chance to be tested and receive the ultimate reward: immortality.

dark_chariot_mount.name: Dark Chariot
dark_chariot_mount.fluff: Built in a great diversity of styles reflecting both local cultures and often the unearthly proclivities of daemon crafters, these armoured vehicles are intended as homage to the rider’s patron deity. Adorned with blades, spikes, bones and eldritch glyphs, both practical and decorative, their ferocious charges can spell woe for any target.

doomlord.name: Doomlord
doomlord.tags:
Path of the Exiled,
		Metal Armour
doomlord.fluff: The Path of the Exiled is the hardest of roads to travel. Approaching the peak of this slippery slope, these legendary, steel-willed postulants seek to conquer their fate and find salvation – or forever fall in the attempt. The gods’ power runs unchecked in their greatly enlarged bodies, resulting in terrifying forms and savage mastery of the tools of war.

exalted_herald.name: Exalted Herald
exalted_herald.endtext:
Abiding Spirit Hard Target(1). Hand of Glory (Occultism) Brand of the Dragon Fly,Swiftstride,Breath Attack(Str 4, AP 1, Flaming Attacks). The Devouring Dark (Occultism) Emissary of Chaos Stomp Attack(D6),Battle Fever,. Pentagram of Pain (Occultism) Sorcerer Immortal Veil Walker,. Umbral Majesty (Occultism) and
The Grave Calls (Occultism) Unholy Avatar +1 Str, +1 AP, and Divine Attacks. Blood Curse (Occultism)
exalted_herald.fluff: The pinnacle of a Warrior’s journey, these former mortals have Ascended to become ageless supernal avatars: the manifestation of Father Chaos’ will in this plane. Adopting whatever form best suits their task, they return from the Immortal Realm filled with Abyssal power and a drive to champion their eternal master.

fallen.name: Fallen
fallen.tags:
Path of the Exiled,
		Metal Armour
fallen.fluff: Those judged unworthy by the Seven are swiftly discarded. Yet, with the gifts they’ve already received, they are not without use. Father Chaos offers these fallen Warriors a last chance to prove themselves on a new Path. The power within them no longer contained by a patron, their flesh bulges and melds with their armour: now they may never remove it again.

feldrak_ancestor.name: Feldrak Ancestor
feldrak_ancestor.fluff: Ancient, primal forebears of the feldraks, these hulking creatures retain much of their draconic legacy. Rivalling the mightiest of their hated rivals, the oldest and largest can still summon up the last vestiges of fire within, belching forth destruction, and often leading bands dedicated to their own causes.

feldrak_elder.name: Feldrak Elder
feldrak_elder.fluff: Most feldraks grow to enormous size and power as they age, much like their dragon ancestors. Wielding weapons too large even for ogres, they strike blows that rend armour, stone and flesh asunder. The bellows of these reptilian beasts taking to the field can demoralise the fiercest of foes.

feldraks.name: Feldraks
feldraks.fluff: It is said that feldraks were once dragons: from scaled skin to reptilian lower bodies, resistance to flame, and imposing size and bearing, they clearly display characteristics of this ancient connection. Mourning their lost wings, they nurture a passionate loathing for true dragons and, by extension, anything that moves in the sky, tearing down such creatures with terrifying ferocity.

flayers.name: Flayers
flayers.fluff: Cruelty is not a quality unique to Warriors, but while many barbarians may approach nobility in their own way, those called flayers have no such ambition. Mounting the fastest beasts to be found, they terrorise soldiers and civilians alike, turning their vicious whips on all in their path and vanishing back into the shadows before any defence can be mustered.

forsaken_one.name: Forsaken One
forsaken_one.fluff: Doomlords and Chosen Lords alike may fall at the final and most brutal of hurdles in their journey to Ascension. For those who attempt the ultimate test, there are only two outcomes. Victory and eternal glory, or – more often – a descent into madness, mutation and monstrosity. These great and twisted beasts are all that remains of those who fail.

forsworn.name: Forsworn
forsworn.tags:
Path of the Exiled,
		Metal Armour
forsworn.fluff: The Forsworn are to the Chosen what the Fallen are to the Warriors. Closer to the pinnacle of Ascension, yet having lost the protections of one of the Seven, they swell in size, bodies growing to accommodate the great unchecked power within. Their only hope is to continue on the treacherous Path of the Exiled, and seek to avoid a Wretched fate.

hellmaw.name: Hellmaw
hellmaw.fluff: Of all the beings to accompany Warriors into battle, none are as extraordinary as these living engines. Daemonic presences housed in fleshy bodies, mechanical constructs, or both at once, their gaping jaws are capable of rending the very fabric of the Mortal Realm, binding two locations and ignoring the intervening space.

karkadan_mount.name: Karkadan
karkadan_mount.fluff: Rhino-like in strength and stature, these mighty beasts live in the wild in many parts of the world. Unlike some other Warrior mounts, they’re not typically attracted by high levels of magic, but they do show more affinity for riders pledged to the Dark Gods than anyone else. Civilised peoples have almost never succeeded in taming these savage monsters.

marauding_giant.name: Marauding Giant
marauding_giant.fluff: Giants travel the world in their adolescence and find homes with all manner of peoples. Among the most common destinations for such beings to settle, particularly those of a brutal disposition, is with the barbarians who often join Warrior warbands. Some giants even show a knack for the mystical arts, attracting the attention of the odd sorcerer.

scythed_skywheel_mount.name: Scythed Skywheel
scythed_skywheel_mount.fluff: Constructed by conclaves of sorcerers and daemons, these imposing platforms are endowed with the ability to ignore gravity itself. Whether made of flesh or mineral, they’re ideal means of transport in battle, allowing the greatest among a warband to attack or evade more effectively, and their fixed blades make them quite deadly to any who dare approach.

shadow_chaser_mount.name: Shadow Chaser
shadow_chaser_mount.fluff: One of the mutant species that has emerged in proximity to areas of high magic, shadow chasers are typically sleek and elongated in form, making them less robust but much faster than most horses. This useful adaptation for the dangers of the wilderness can prove an equally valuable resource in battle.

sorcerer.name: Sorcerer
sorcerer.fluff: Either wizards seeking an illicit path to power or those raised among daemons from infancy, sorcerers act as prophets of the Dark Gods. Travelling the world, supporting acolytes in civilised lands, and seeking out new devotees to swear their oaths to the Seven, they bring powerful magic to bear with the unique capacity of one linked to the Abyss.

war_dais_mount.name: War Dais
war_dais_mount.fluff: Though Warriors rarely relish another’s glory, most acknowledge that those favoured by the gods are worthy of respect. It is a sign of true greatness for a lord of the Seven to be willingly borne by a retinue upon a throne of dreadful trophies, the better to slay more foes and grow their legend yet further.

warhounds.name: Warhounds
warhounds.fluff: A faithful canine may seem out of place among ruthless Warriors, yet many warbands are fiercely devoted to keeping packs of trained and bloodthirsty hounds. Strict masters hold their dogs in check, yet upon command they can be let slip to ferocious effect.

warrior_chariot.name: Warrior Chariot
warrior_chariot.tags:
Path of the Favoured,
		Metal Armour,
warrior_chariot.fluff: Warriors aren’t known for their crafting talents; it’s likely that these scythed and armoured chariots are acquired from the same daemonic smiths as the armour worn by their riders. Whatever the origin, they are crewed to devastating effect.

warrior_knights.name: Warrior Knights
warrior_knights.tags:
Metal Armour,
		Path of the Favoured,
warrior_knights.fluff: While many Warriors choose to remain on foot, trusting no other creature to bear them into battle, some opt for the pace of a warhorse to carry them all the faster to the heart of the enemy lines, at the vanguard of an armoured host.

warriors.name: Warriors
warriors.tags:
Path of the Favoured,
		Metal Armour
warriors.fluff: Setting out on the Path of the Favoured, Warriors adorn themselves in suits of daemonically-forged armour, cementing the pact they swear to the Dark Gods. Rendering their soul forfeit, the godly power they gain makes them some of the most dangerous fighters in the world, able to endure any hardship to prove themselves worthy of advancement.

wasteland_behemoth_mount.name: Wasteland Behemoth
wasteland_behemoth_mount.fluff: The Wasteland was once open steppe; the Shattered Sea borders the wide prairie; the Heart of the Desert lies within reach of the great savannah. These and other sites of significant magical intensity have led to the drastic transformation of the already gigantic beasts that dwelled in such regions; today they are appalling mutant titans ever-ready to unleash devastation.

wasteland_dragon_mount.name: Wasteland Dragon
wasteland_dragon_mount.fluff: Dragons can inherently manipulate magic, but those exposed to unnaturally high levels of the substance, and to the Wasteland’s many dangers, have changed. They spend less and less time in the skies, preferring to prowl at great speed over the ground, yet retaining their enormous power and living flame. Some have selected great Warriors as worthy riders.

wretched_ones.name: Wretched Ones
wretched_ones.fluff: Former Warriors who incur the Dark Gods’ wrath, and whom even Father Chaos does not save, always have further to fall. Rock bottom rests in the forms of these tortured creatures. Misshapen figures betraying just the barest vestiges of their former selves, they seem to exist only to shamble in the direction of the enemies of their one-time comrades.

horse_archers.name: Horse Archers
horse_archers.fluff: Our warrior code is a way of life and it extends to our horses, the closest and oldest of our allies. Their loyalty is complete and ancient, our families and their bloodlines intertwine far beyond the telling. We are as one. We live or die, together. All Makhar can ride and are masters of the bow, our survival demands it and no man can match us. We ride before we walk and shoot before we talk. With our bows a Makhar Horse Archer is to be feared, appearing without warning and fading away as fast. The last sound many have heard is the flight of our arrows.

karkadan_herd.name: Karkadan Herd
karkadan_herd.fluff: Our guide continues to find our ignorance amusing. Many months after we left Volskagrad, we camped the night in a rocky river basin next to a watering hole fed by a small stream. Upon awakening with the morning sun I went to stretch my legs and loose my bladder. Much to my surprise, I was confronted across the watering hole by a furry beast with a gigantic nose-horn slurping greedily. In my excitement at being the first man of Zilas to experience the majesty of a unicorn, I awoke the camp with my screams of delight. Once roused, our guide promptly dismissed my discovery and informed me of the beast's true nature. As if in agreement, the karkadan turned and released its bowels in my direction, kicking its back legs to spread its steaming faeces. With a grunt it promptly rumbled off into the tundra to join its herd.	Excerpt from the diary and travels of Columbo Vinaroni. Embassy of Zilas to the Great Khan---found in the Gyula's Pavilion

makhar_chariot.name: Makhar Chariots
makhar_chariot.fluff: You want to know what haunts my nightmares? Thirty years I was a Reiter. Seen, fought, and killed most anything that walks, flies, or crawls. I've fought plenty of cavalry and infantry, easy kills for the repeaters, but that chariot was the worst I faced I'll never forget it. Four warriors to deal with, two of them riding the horses caused us a lot of problems. Either too many bows, or too many of those damned heavy lances. Lost good men that day, Ullor bless them. Now, hand me that bottle.	Sgt JG Holtz, former Reiter, now guide to the Makhar

makhar_flayers.name: Makhar Flayers
makhar_flayers.fluff: Among the Makhar, some follow a darker path. That of the Flayer. Where the herdsman is content with his horses and sheep, the Flayer seeks more exotic and sometimes dangerous pastoral beasts. Chimeras, turuls, karkadans, and in rare cases humans; the more dangerous the herd, the more prestigious in the eyes of a Flayer. To control these perilous and unpredictable herds, Flayers mount the most spirited creatures: Shadow Chasers.

makhar_gyula.name: Makhar Gyula
makhar_gyula.fluff: Our Gyulas lead by example, gifted leaders, as skilled in war as they are in holding together the fractious elements of our people. This is no easy task and many fall to the usurper's blade or the enemy's spear. Those that master this enigmatic art are elevated almost to the status of gods. When their time on the Steppe is at an end we raise massive earth mounds to house their treasures in this realm and the next. The weak are left in the grass for the wolves.

makhar_lancers.name: Makhar Lancers
makhar_lancers.fluff: We are the Gyula's shock cavalry. We ride larger horses than most Makhar, Kadzoly warmbloods, specially bred in the lands bordering Vetia. Wielding fearsome double-handed lances, we close with the enemy with terrifying speed, devastating our foes with bone splintering force. Either skewered by lance or smashed lifeless by flailing hooves, the role of the lancers is to decimate arrow-riddled units, sending them fleeing or to their graves.	Elac---Makhar Lancer

nomadic_giant.name: Nomadic Giant
nomadic_giant.fluff: Some Steppe people foster relations with the wandering giants of the grasslands. Although their lumbering gait is dissimilar to our highly mobile warriors, they can be brutal in battle and in simple imitation of our archers some sport mighty bows that launch gigantic arrows of death to smash apart our foes. A fine sight indeed.

steppe_mammoth.name: Steppe Mammoth
steppe_mammoth.fluff: Entering the valley from over a high pass, the green sea of grass spread out before us like verdant silk slung carelessly across a floor. The deep blue of the morning sky met the boundless green of the steppe. The only thing disturbing the idyllic folds of the grasslands appeared to be large boulders clumped together haphazardly. On closer inspection these boulders seemed to possess a heavy fur coat. When I remarked this to our guide he almost fell off his horse with laughter. He informed us that these boulders were in fact humongous beasts and quite approachable when grazing. However, if roused to anger, these mamuts, he divulged, are unstoppable behemoths of rage. They are herded and ridden in the same way as horses and their milk is fermented as a highly prized delicacy along the Makhar tribes---kumis, powerful liquor.	Excerpt from the diary and travels of Columbo Vinaroni. Embassy of Zilas to the Great Khan---found in the Gyula's Pavillion

steppe_wolfhounds.name: Steppe Wolfhounds
steppe_wolfhounds.fluff: The Steppe harbours many fearsome beasts. As children we learn of these terrors---the stories told around the fire create a healthy fear. The young are entrusted to guard the herds, and to aid them we keep dogs. These are no fireside lapdogs familiar to the settled people, but bred over centuries as the fiercest and fastest of their kind.

táltos.name: Táltos
táltos.fluff: There are some amongst us who see that which is beyond most Makhar. They perceive the living, beating heart of the Steppe, feel the pulsing rhythms of the winds, and commune with the spirit of our land. Their way is no easy path, these Táltos; they are as much part of our war horde as the horses or bows. We expect them to fight alongside us, to live and die as we do, in the cauldron of battle. Their skills which bring the power of the Steppe crashing into our enemies has turned many battles in our favour.

tamyir_vassals.name: Tamyir Vassals
tamyir_vassals.fluff: We were ready for their horsemen, knew they would be coming. Spent all day digging shallow pits and covering them with mown grass to break their horses' legs. Well, the peasants did, obviously I only supervised. But the horses never came, just hordes of wild Tamyir Vassals on foot. We were overrun in a heartbeat.	Baron Luis de Châtray, formerly an Equitan Questing Knight, latterly a dung shoveller

turul.name: Turul
turul.fluff: I am struggling to get the turul eggs you requested, Master. These creatures are smarter than eagles. When the mother goes off to hunt and I see her wings disappear over the horizon, I begin my descent. Every time I am within metres of her nest my spotter shouts down to me and I must abort the climb. It's as though the damned turul can see me from miles away! These beasts are fearsome, truly. With the hindquarters of a mountain lion and the claws, head, and wings of a giant hawk I dare not get close to the nest when she is within sight. I would be ripped to shreds. Another method must be found.	Taken from a letter found in the Gyula's Pavilion

warrior_knights.name: Warrior Knights
warrior_knights.fluff: Makhar who have sworn themselves to the Dark Gods often return to their homes on the Steppe to fulfill their path for reasons that are unclear to even the Táltos. Nonetheless, we welcome them, as their prowess in battle is undoubted.

åsklander_chief.name: Åsklander Chief
åsklander_chief.fluff: To lead is the destiny of the jarls and hersirs. But leading should be tested: trials must be endured and challenges won, for a chieftain should prove not only the strongest of the tribe, but the wisest also. Proud and dauntless, feared and respected, such are the demands of leadership.

åsklander_flayers.name: Åsklander Flayers
åsklander_flayers.fluff: Riding huge wolves, spiders, and all manner of breakneck beasts, the role of the flayer is reserved for the most courageous and aggressive members of our tribes. Often hardened survivors without families, flayers are among the most feared of those we dread to face. Their speed and brutality is like a vicious blizzard, scouring the flesh and obliterating all hope.

åsklander_horsemen.name: Åsklander Horsemen
åsklander_horsemen.fluff: Mounts are considered a privilege among the most important Åsklander families. They are generally given to the youngest warriors, to prove themselves as scouts and vanguards of raiding forces, as there is limited space for horses on a longboat.

åsklanders.name: Åsklanders
åsklanders.fluff: The Åsklander is a fighter to be feared: strengthened by harsh living and long hunts through the forest, each man and maiden of our people is skilled with axe or bow and born to raiding.

berserkers.name: Berserkers
berserkers.fluff: Gnashing teeth, crazed howling, deranged biting of shields---a ferocious blur of axes, bleeding steel, and bear pelts: these are the berserkers of Vigi. He asked of them to be the nightmare of the elven enemy, and they became as such. They do not fear death, nor defeat, for their only purpose is killing elves.

huskarls.name: Huskarls
huskarls.fluff: No one can become a jarl without the support of the huskarls, and new jarls are often elected from their number, for they are not only bodyguards but a warrior elite. Seasoned fighters, their wisdom and ruthlessness in matters of war and raiding is rarely matched by younger warriors and chiefs.

trolls.name: Ice Trolls
trolls.fluff: Trolls are hardy creatures. So much so, that it is rumoured neither man nor nature can kill them. The beasts that inhabit the frozen lands are no exception. As grotesque, greedy, and ill-tempered as their southern cousins, their tough, icy hide emits a palpable aura of cold so fierce it has even been known to extinguish fire.

jötunn.name: Jötunn
jötunn.fluff:
Walk upon a mountainous road, and you may find yourself in the vicinity of one of the mightiest creatures to inhabit the earth---a jötunn.

	The first you will know is the drop in temperature; your skin will burn and your bones freeze, until you can barely crawl. A mist of freezing air will rise around you. The next sign is the ground shuddering; the very mountain appears to split, until blue-grey flesh resolves from blue-grey rock.

	Last, eyes open. Vast eyes, with a red hue, taking moments to focus upon the tiny creatures before it.

	If you are fortunate, you will be accompanied by a seidhkennar, who can fathom the landslide rumbling that passes for language between them. If you are truly blessed, your guide can settle that mountain back to sleep, before the mighty being decides to crush those who disturb its slumber.

	Returning to cold stone's embrace, it might be years before the jötunn rises again, but time seems to matter little to their kind. I simply pray I am never the cause of their ire, or have reason to defend against them---castle walls can only do so much!My Time in the North---Lionel Bethune,\ Baron of Equitaine

kraken.name: Kraken
kraken.fluff: The most experienced raiding jarls and seidhkennars develop a deep connection with the seas, and have even proved able to tame and master these legendary creatures, often luring them away from isolated forces of dread elves.

marauding_giant.name: Marauding Giant
marauding_giant.fluff: Those few giants living near our settlements are accepted and looked after by most tribes. While they are generally solitary and unpredictable beings, they usually learn how to behave on an expedition, and often develop strong bonds with individual Åsklanders.

seidhkennar.name: Seidhkennar
seidhkennar.fluff: Seidhkennars are the voice of the gods, advisers of the jarls, guides to the berserkers. They are tellers of sagas, masters of magic, and speakers with all the creatures of the North. No force would dare to raid without their blessing, nor a king march to war: for the seers of Åskland know the spirit of the land.

wargs.name: Wargs
wargs.fluff: Wargs are not mere pet wolves, trained to attack on command. They are born of Ullr's fury, impervious to the rigours of a mountain winter, tougher and sometimes larger than a horse. A single warg can down a giant elk if it catches it unaware, and a pack is a serious danger even to well-armed travellers. You are never free of the warg's nose. It will track you for days if it deems you a worthy prize. If you are fierce enough, you can steal the pups and harness this fury yourself: but be sure to serve Ullr well, or you'll be a meal for the beast soon enough.

warhounds.name: Warhounds
warhounds.fluff: Hunting is our oldest and most indispensable tradition. The deepest bonds of man and beast are forged from the cradle with our hunting packs. Our hounds are no foppish southern pups, but proud heirs of the great wolves of the northern forest. Long generations of careful stewardship have created one of the smartest and most dangerous breeds of warhounds ever seen.

warriors.name: Warriors
warriors.fluff: Åsklanders who have sworn to the Dark Gods often return to their homes to fulfil their path, for reasons that are unclear even to seidhkennars. Nonetheless, they are always welcomed among the ranks of a raiding party, as their prowess in battle is doubted by none.

blasted_plains_emissaries.name: Blasted Plains Emissaries
blasted_plains_emissaries.fluff: The finest of our people are, of course, those honoured with permission to visit the great Citadels. These universally admired hobgoblins are invariably enlightened by the company and generosity of the Masters. To us, they seem to return with some measure of dwarven discipline and battle-vigour, as well as fine arms and armour. Still, weapons are not the warrior, so claims that dwarven-trained soldiers should count double towards levy limits should clearly be dismissed.

eternals.name: Eternals
eternals.fluff: In honour of the Masters, the finest warrior-nobles in Papak have taken to wearing steel masks in the style of the legendary Immortals. These worthy hobgoblins are hunters, however, not warriors---their knives are made for the bleeding of the beasts of the plains, not the foes of the Citadel. The presence of a Shah's hunting party near a battlefield is most likely an unintentional cause of any such battles, as defending their Masters is the only priority of all hobgoblins. Insinuations that such engagements might be engineered should be disregarded.

hob_auxiliaries.name: Hob Auxiliaries
hob_auxiliaries.fluff: Left to our devices, it is notable and shameful that we Hobgoblins are forced to adopt a less forceful approach to confrontations. Shepherds throwing stones are our own levy, troops as far below our own trained warriors as our warriors are below the Masters. Naturally, this leads to them being categorised as auxiliary adjuncts to standard forces.

hob_ballista.name: Hob Ballista
hob_ballista.fluff: Pursuant to section 743B, the maintenance and operation of torsion-powered supplementary artillery is continued, but restricted in operation and design to senior engineers who have served as clerks and apprentices to the Temple of Nezibkesh.

hob_cataphracts.name: Hob Cataphracts
hob_cataphracts.fluff: Among the more notable of our specialist levies are the bear-dog riding Cataphracts. Skilled in bow and spear, most are veterans of glorious service to the Masters. Should the Masters ever feel the need to call upon older, slower cavalry to supplement their forces, the Cataphracts stand ready to answer the call.

hobgoblin_conjurer.name: Hobgoblin Conjurer
hobgoblin_conjurer.fluff: It is a fact of existence that the mystical arts are essential to victory on the field of battle. We are blessed to have dwarf-trained conjurers, and they are naturally loyal to the Masters. Should you require their assistance in battle, they will be made available in an instant. Attached are their specific credentials and accreditations.

hob_levies.name: Hob Levies
hob_levies.fluff: You know, oh great Overlord, that we train our soldiers to the standards set by the Masters. Levies comprise the heart of our own military forces, and are matched against such foes as it is appropriate for us to battle. Some few may deviate slightly from standard protocols, but we would not dream of wasting the Masters' time with them.

hob_savaran.name: Hob Savaran
hob_savaran.fluff: Hobgoblins are sworn to serve, and so we require strong leadership and a hierarchy that stretches below the Shah and the Satraps. Savarans lead our people in battle, in trade, and in training. Should you have new doctrines you wish to employ, simply send a message to a Savaran; it will be their honour to follow your commands.

mountain_wolf_cavalry.name: Mountain Wolf Cavalry
mountain_wolf_cavalry.fluff: The flower of our youth and the pinnacle of wolfmanship, our riders should be a familiar sight to our glorious Masters. Trained in bow and spear, it is the swiftness of the mountain wolf that is most prized. These are excellent warriors and we understand the constant demand for their training from our superiors. Pursuant to section 287, we would like to apply for an expansion of the wolf breeding program, to better supply the Masters with well-trained riders.

drum_gogyag.name: Regimental Gogyag
drum_gogyag.fluff: Some hobgoblin regiments have magnificent miscellaneous mascots. With training and care, such creatures can often carry, and sometimes even play, the great hob-drums of war. Per section 647D, unit mascots are, of course, not counted as soldiers under arms or cavalry. The recent trend of adopting the largest and fiercest beasts of the Blasted Plains as mascots was initiated by the soldiers, who seem to take it as a point of pride to find the most majestic mascot. All to honour the Masters, of course.

shah.name: Satrap
shah.fluff: The Shah of Papak is unfailingly loyal to our glorious Overlord, as are the satraps. Our rulers lead our people, and will happily dispatch as many troops as requested to the service of that most magnificent of Citadels, Karutab, whenever required. Naturally, there is no need for them to go to war themselves—it will serve your greatness better to keep them in the palace, supervising tax collection.

sky_mountain_emissaries.name: Sky Mountain Emissaries
sky_mountain_emissaries.fluff: Finally, reports may have circulated as to the inclusion of camel-based cavalry squadrons equipped with export grade firearms that would exceed our allowance of powder and ammunition. These are utterly unfounded; the incident in question occurred when the Red Ridge Consortium's envoys were swept into a conflict on the Steel Road through simple misfortune. They fought bravely to protect their dwarven Master's investment, not for the Shah.

tusker_mahouts.name: Tusker Mahouts
tusker_mahouts.fluff: Construction projects never fail to benefit from the might of a tamed tusker. Such beasts are an asset in forestry, agriculture and transport. The occasional presence of a herd of tuskers near an army can generally be explained as part of the supply train. Any sightings of particularly large beasts, bred from ogre stock and equipped with giant war platforms are likely cases of mistaken identity---we would not militarily employ such creatures in excess of standard regulations on military forces (per 322D).

brute_disciples.name: Brute Disciples
brute_disciples.fluff: Despite possessing an intellect inverse to their size and strength, happily some brutes have nonetheless been able to grasp the basics tenets of the faith. Indeed, with the help of priests who possess the virtue of patience, and repeated sermons, these hulking vermin now number among our most effective and enthusiastic converts.

cult_converts.name: Cult Converts
cult_converts.fluff: Just as we have gladly welcomed you, the first believers in Avras, into our congregation, so have fresh converts flocked to our temples across the Republic. Like you, they seek redemption, meaning, and a more just world. Even those who have not yet been tested and found true may have their role to play, supporting God’s armies in their untold numbers, and learning the faith by their example – for God loves all who can be made sick.

favoured_disciple_mount.name: Favoured Disciple
favoured_disciple_mount.fluff: The greatest and most devoted of the brute disciples are assigned to protect those who are holiest in God’s eyes. Their hearts and minds are gladly filled with faith, and their prodigious endurance allows them to survive symptoms that would fell unbelievers a dozen times over – a sure sign of the Plaguefather’s favour!

giant_plague_rats.name: Giant Plague Rats
giant_plague_rats.fluff: The Lord has a design for all creatures. Even those rodents who have failed to attain the knowledge of good and evil that marks out an intelligent being, once infected, might do God’s work as a holy vector for the transmission of His sacrament. Our quadrupedal pets can reach great sizes, and they are savage in battle, assailing the Plaguefather’s enemies with animal speed and ferocity.

infected_giant.name: Infected Giant
infected_giant.fluff: I rejoice to tell you that some among the wandering titans have heard the Plaguefather’s call, and several have even survived their holy baptism. They have become the mightiest evangelists of the gospel of Plague, spreading the great truth of pestilence and salvation as they march forward beside our armies.

leper_monks.name: Leper Monks
leper_monks.fluff: Orders of our leprous brothers and sisters that reside in the mountain monasteries near the Prophet’s Tomb have organised martial fraternities in recent years, to better aid the spread of God’s infections. Having been blessed with maladies hazardous even to the faithful, these brothers in worship are inoculated against all pain by their faith and virtue. Under the banner of their order and a cloud of flies, their very presence on the field spells sure demise for the Lord’s foes.

leprous_cauldron_mount.name: Leprous Cauldron
leprous_cauldron_mount.fluff: The Lord fills these sacred vessels with purifying afflictions that cause deformation and desensitisation of the flesh, and they go forth atop lumbering chariots pulled by our most ardent followers from the fire swamps. When battle is joined, the cauldron’s guardian stirs the holy discharge contained within the crucible, creating a thick miasma that fortifies the faithful against all wickedness.

pestilent_onager.name: Pestilent Onager
pestilent_onager.fluff: Great catapults were used in the first plague rebellions of old; they are equally effective in defence of the Plaguefather’s strongholds as they are besieging those of His enemies. Large pots of bile-brew are flung at enemy formations or dwellings, their swift-acting contents sapping the life-force of those who have rejected the word of God. The faithful rejoice in the pungent aroma that soon spreads.

plague_acolytes.name: Plague Acolytes
plague_acolytes.fluff: Our most ardent and beloved disciples, those who have embraced seven sacred plagues, can achieve the rank of acolyte, and may receive a vision of the last days from the Most Holy and Pestilent Censer. They are forever changed by this encounter, having seen the ending of the world through plague and death, and the dreadful coming of the Lord God Himself.

plague_disciples.name: Plague Disciples
plague_disciples.fluff: Those who have given their life to the Plaguefather have not only withstood His cleansing plagues, but also accepted the transient nature of earthly life and the inevitability of death. Beloved of Avras, I tell you: together, these are the keys to salvation! Sure in the knowledge they have been saved, our followers take to righteous battle with great joy. An uncommon courage fills their putrid hearts, and the goodly infections of the Lord coat their blades.

plague_patriarch.name: Plague Patriarch
plague_patriarch.fluff: Our patriarchs are the defenders of the faith, spreading the gospel by the sword, and bringing pestilence and war to the doors of the unbelievers. They are as fathers to the afflicted, guiding them down the path of illness and rooting out heretics that would “cure” the faith. Blessed by the Plaguefather with preternatural resilience, death will not take them until their appointed time has come.

plague_swarms.name: Plague Swarms
plague_swarms.fluff: The smallest beings too have a part to play in the Lord’s salvation. In His mercy, God made the common rat to dwell in every part of the world, and its nature to spread the blessed plagues wherever they may go, and devour also the grain of the unbelievers. These humble and contagious servants of the divine will flock to the call of any priest or war-leader who speaks the truth of the Plaguefather.

sacred_platform_mount.name: Sacred Platform
sacred_platform_mount.fluff: To glorify God, we use mighty trees felled by leaf-blight to build platforms from which the priesthood can deliver wondrous sermons to the masses, spreading the holy infection yet further. In battle, these blessed chariots provide a suitable station from which the knowledge of God’s purpose can enter the minds and sinuses of both believers and infidels.

swarm_priest.name: Swarm Priest
swarm_priest.fluff: The spiritual guides of our faith, these preachers of truth are the inheritors of the Prophet’s word. They safeguard the minds of Errahman’s children from heresies and ensure unity among the faithful. They work together in blessed trios, using magic so that God’s power might touch the world, spreading the consecrated contagion, filling the hearts of unbelievers with holy terror and the afflicted with sacred purpose.

underworld_beast.name: Underworld Beast
underworld_beast.fluff: The great troglodyte creatures of the Deeps are as susceptible to the truth of plague as the beasts of the field or the birds in the sky. Once they bear the mark of our congregation, they are purified of the influence of the false Caelysian gods, becoming instead champions of the Plaguefather and heralds of the last days.

urban_agitators.name: Urban Agitators
urban_agitators.fluff: The disaffected and dispossessed swarm across every city-warren of the Republic, failed and abandoned by the Senate’s godless leadership. Many are willing to spread their patron’s propaganda for mere coin, and have developed talents useful for provocation in many settings. Imagine how much greater their potential when they are brought into the fold!

avatar_of_harag.name: Avatar of Harag
avatar_of_harag.fluff: Supernals loyal to Harag are said to be able to possess certain sea monsters, or even manifest new forms in areas of high magic deep within the oceans. If called by her priests, they will sometimes come to shore for battle: the incarnation of their mistress’ unpitying caprice and changeability. Many believe they can turn the very land to sea – or at least salt-water marsh – in advance of Daeb attacks. Perhaps this is merely a folk explanation for the phenomenon of localised tidal waves behind which corsair raiders have been known to arrive.	From The Gods of the Elves by Damsel Guérarde Stockmunde

corsairs.name: Corsairs
corsairs.fluff: Alike to the pack of wolves who stalk sheep pens at night, corsairs hunt the coasts from Destria to Tsuandan. They’re our predators. Lightning  fast and deadly. Their eyes are keen and their hide cloaks tough. As fearsome raiders as ever did sail the seas. None knows when they’ll strike, but you can be sure that they’re out there. Aye, lad. All sailors know of the elven corsairs who sail under the Black Flag. And rightly so.	Overheard warning from a fisherman to his son

dread_captain.name: Dread Captain
dread_captain.fluff: Urchein is a member of the Slaver faction. She is feared both as a duelist and a raider. Her prowess with a blade is legendary, and it’s likely she was the captain of the vessel that sunk or captured the majority of our third squadron seven years ago off Gan Dareb. My sources have informed me that she is already amassing wealth, cutting deals with the taming schools and preparing ships and supplies. The Republic’s navy will not support her, but she will likely sponsor an army of privateers, corsairs and freebooters from across the north of Silexia.	Intelligence gathered from Rathaen by an anonymous agent of the Pearl Throne

dread_mariners.name: Dread Mariners
dread_mariners.fluff:
After the grapnels had snagged our rigging we repelled the first wave of boarders after heavy fighting. The second wave was different. Calm and collected, with a discipline of years or possibly centuries at sea, stalwart elven marines launched themselves with unnatural elegance onto the deck of the Irène. They were clad in semi-translucent kraken hide that seemed to blend with their surroundings. Wielding wicked two-handed blades, they carved through the sailors with ease. I survived to tell this tale only by throwing myself into the ocean, joining my compatriots and putting myself at the mercy of the sea.
	Ship’s log, Serember 12, 944 AS. Captain Adémar de Talharmé of the merchant vessel Irène

kraken.name: Kraken
kraken.fluff:
On it came, sudden, roiling and vast from the shallows to our lee, just when we thought we were safe. The water churned as it surged forward with white mane foaming, its great baleful eye fixed upon us with all the loathing of a malicious intelligence. Before we could roll out the guns, it gripped the bowsprit and foremast and heaved bodily onto the deck, laying waste with long whipping arms on all sides. A midshipman was seized by the ankles and deposited into its gnashing maw, even as the mast cracked and came down around us.
	From the memoirs of Admiral Egberta van Luten

renegade_assassin.name: Renegade Assassin
renegade_assassin.fluff: There is one black-clad figure among Urchein’s party that even the most blooded warriors fear. They say he was taken at birth and moulded into the perfect killer, given no name, no family, no will but that of the Hunting Lodges of Caedhren (Cadaron) where he was kept. We have long known of the terrible efficiency and precision of these agents of death, reserved for sanctioned missions, and not permitted to join private armies or raiding fleets. Yet this one seems somehow to have broken through the best efforts of his masters and gained self-determination. Fugitive but finally free, he has taken Urchein’s contract – presumably to get as far from Silexian shores as possible. 	Intelligence gathered from Rathaen by an anonymous agent of the Pearl Throne

salt_veterans.name: Salt Veterans
salt_veterans.fluff: I have infiltrated a crew sailing north, posing as an apprentice to a squadron of veteran corsairs. I have never seen warriors as cruel in manner and appearance. As well as the thick, salt-stained ocean leathers common to all members of the fleet, the skin of the chattel they capture adorns their armour, paired with trophies of past kills. Silence surrounds them as they swagger through the streets of Rathaen, flaunting elaborately wicked blades. Feared even by their own crew, their countenance is grim and resolute. Similar groups are not rare among the fleets and are to be considered highly dangerous.	Intelligence gathered from Rathaen by an anonymous agent of the Pearl Throne

seaboard_exarch.name: Seaboard Exarch
seaboard_exarch.fluff: I was roughly forced to kneel. The appearance of the Storm Witch’s priestess was savage: one with the wind and brine, dressed in immaculate robes of disdainful elegance, yet deadly, well-worn and set with whalebone. Unable and unwilling to maintain eye contact, I bowed my head as she approached, bare feet passing inches in front of my nose before gliding to a halt. The sailor’s death was silent and sudden. The crimson liquid made little contrast on the galley’s deeply bloodstained decks. A horrific reminder of centuries of Harag’s victims.	Excerpt from a survivor’s account

sea-fog_leviathan.name: Sea-Fog Leviathan
sea-fog_leviathan.fluff:
As the tale progressed, the contours of his wrinkled visage in the pallid light made horrendous grimaces. “The mist was like pea soup, rolling off the sea, over the docks, over the whole town; most unnatural, most uncanny fast it came, so you could not e’en see your hand before your face. The screaming started on the pier, as a great dark shape came floating from the waves, like the devil’s own cutter. Then it was on us. Billhooks and harpoons no good against the deathly touch of slimy tendrils, turning spine to jelly so’s you couldn’t move, except to holler from the agony".
	Excerpt from The Glaucan’s Revenge by Antigoni Tassiades

sea_wolves.name: Sea Wolves
sea_wolves.fluff:
Delirious. Temperature high. Shallow puncture wounds on the lower thigh. I will administer antivenom and attempt to bring her temperature down.
	The patient remains in delirium. She screams at night and babbles about sea serpents with forked tongues.
	Deceased. Her comrades claim the elven raiders drove packs of some sort of aquatic reptile against them. Others called them lobos – I don’t know if this is merely a name, or a description. I will continue to study her corpse in the hope of learning more.
	Medical notes from a Santa Genoveva infirmary

thunder_riders.name: Thunder Riders
thunder_riders.fluff: Urchein has been busy growing her support. As we were aware, the Daeb taming schools are partners in many of her raiding expeditions. The coming ventures will be no different. She has recruited from the lesser nobility, known for using naval pegasi and embracing the cult of Harag to curry favour with the sailors, calling themselves harbingers of storm and tempest. I can testify to the psychological and practical advantages they bring to any raiding fleet.	Intelligence gathered from Rathaen by an anonymous agent of the Pearl Throne

tritons.name: Tritons
tritons.fluff: We know that the gorgons were created by the Temple of Yema using a ritual merging of supernal and elf, but most Daeb have shunned such practices for their high risk and waste of life. The only other cult known to attempt the unholy union is a certain militant sect devoted to the Storm Witch. Harag’s immortal minions, when successfully bonded, take the form of fey witches able to breathe both air and water. As befits such children of the waves, these tritons are changeable and capricious, known to perform works of magic and weave cruel temptations in small pods. I can hear them at night from the sea, following our ship day by day.	Intelligence gathered from Rathaen by an anonymous agent of the Pearl Throne
tritons.wizardconclave: The unit selects its spells from the following:

warlock_freebooter.name: Warlock Freebooter
warlock_freebooter.fluff: Expect raids in the coming season. Urchein has already amassed a fleet of more than forty  ships. Also be aware that at least six highly skilled wizards will be aboard. These fortune-seekers are mercenaries hired from outcast communities. Some are even traitorous graduates from our own colleges. The Throne can find a full report on these “warlocks” in its archives, but note that they wield considerable power.	Intelligence gathered from Rathaen by an anonymous agent of the Pearl Throne

burning_wheel_mount.name: Burning Wheel
burning_wheel_mount.fluff: Sometimes composed of flesh and other times of metal, these peculiar daemons appear to have little will of their own, being content to convey their superior kin. Shaped like discs and often producing the illusion of kaleidoscopic flames, they have the ability to float effortlessly through the air.

dark_pulpit_mount.name: Dark Pulpit
dark_pulpit_mount.fluff: Daemons are the ultimate evangelists of the Dark Gods; even as they attempt to tear down the world, they also seek converts to their scandalous faith. From the summit of this abyssal chariot – sometimes drawn on the backs of lesser daemons, other times levitating serenely – they can preach the word of their masters and glorify their names.

great_beast_of_prophecy_mount.name: Great Beast of Prophecy
great_beast_of_prophecy_mount.fluff: These dramatic creatures can only be tamed by the strongest-willed daemons. Normally they are chimeric in form, combining parts of the most impressive mortal creatures, but rarely in the same manner as worldly chimeras. These monsters have often plagued the dreams and visions of diviners and prophets, particularly in periods preceding major daemonic incursions.

hellsteed_mount.name: Hellsteed
hellsteed_mount.fluff: While they may be lesser daemons accustomed to serving those of greater potency, the dire steeds of the Dark Gods are fell creatures in their own right. Taking a range of fearsomely fast-moving forms, such beasts have found a niche as the natural mounts for any daemon wishing to move more rapidly across the Mortal Realm.

throne_of_overwhelming_splendour_mount.name: Throne of Overwhelming Splendour
throne_of_overwhelming_splendour_mount.fluff: Reserved exclusively for the highest lieutenants of Savar, these spectacular constructs exude grandeur and unquestionable authority. They are pulled by exotic beasts from the Pride God’s menageries, and can hurtle out of the skies in devastating airborne attacks.
